transliteration:
Innaadhu Irakkap Patudhal Irandhavar
Inmukang Kaanum Alavu
explanation: To see men begging from us in disagreeable, until we see their pleasant countenance

text:
ஆற்றுவார் ஆற்றல் பசிஆற்றல் அப்பசியை
மாற்றுவார் ஆற்றலின் பின்.
translation: Higher's power which hunger cures  Than that of penance which endures
transliteration:
Aatruvaar Aatral Pasiaatral Appasiyai
Maatruvaar Aatralin Pin
explanation: The power of those who perform penance is the power of enduring hunger It is inferior to the power of those who remove the hunger (of others)

text:
அற்றார் அழிபசி தீர்த்தல் அஃதொருவன்
பெற்றான் பொருள்வைப் புழி.
translation: Drive from the poor their gnawing pains  If room you seek to store your gains
transliteration:
Atraar Azhipasi Theerththal Aqdhoruvan
Petraan Porulvaip Puzhi
explanation: The removal of the killing hunger of the poor is the place for one to lay up his wealth

text:
பாத்தூண் மரீஇ யவனைப் பசியென்னும்
தீப்பிணி தீண்டல் அரிது.
translation: Who shares his food with those who need  Hunger shall not harm his creed
transliteration:
Paaththoon Mareei Yavanaip Pasiyennum
Theeppini Theental Aridhu
explanation: The fiery disease of hunger shall never touch him who habitually distributes his food to others

text:
ஈத்துவக்கும் இன்பம் அறியார்கொல் தாமுடைமை
வைத்திழக்கும் வன்க ணவர்.
translation: The joy of give and take they lose  Hard-hearted rich whose hoarding fails
transliteration:
Eeththuvakkum Inpam Ariyaarkol Thaamutaimai
Vaiththizhakkum Vanka Navar
explanation: Do the hard-eyed who lay up and lose their possessions not know the happiness which springs from the pleasure of giving ?

text:
இரத்தலின் இன்னாது மன்ற நிரப்பிய
தாமே தமியர் உணல்.
translation: Worse than begging is that boarding  Alone what one's greed is hoarding
transliteration:
Iraththalin Innaadhu Mandra Nirappiya
Thaame Thamiyar Unal
explanation: Solitary and unshared eating for the sake of filling up one's own riches is certainly much more

text:
சாதலின் இன்னாத தில்லை இனிததூஉம்
ஈதல் இயையாக் கடை.
translation: Nothing is more painful than death  Yet more is pain of giftless dearth
transliteration:
Saadhalin Innaadha Thillai Inidhadhooum
Eedhal Iyaiyaak Katai
explanation: Nothing is more unpleasant than death: yet even that is pleasant where charity cannot be exercised

text:
ஈதல் இசைபட வாழ்தல் அதுவல்லது
ஊதியம் இல்லை உயிர்க்கு.
translation: They gather fame who freely give  The greatest gain for all that live
transliteration:
Eedhal Isaipata Vaazhdhal Adhuvalladhu
Oodhiyam Illai Uyirkku
explanation: Give to the poor and live with praise There is no greater profit to man than that

text:
உரைப்பார் உரைப்பவை எல்லாம் இரப்பார்க்கொன்று
ஈவார்மேல் நிற்கும் புகழ்.
translation: The glory of the alms-giver  Is praised aloud as popular
transliteration:
Uraippaar Uraippavai Ellaam Irappaarkkondru
Eevaarmel Nirkum Pukazh
explanation: Whatsoever is spoken in the world will abide as praise upon that man who gives alms to the poor

text:
ஒன்றா உலகத்து உயர்ந்த புகழல்லால்
பொன்றாது நிற்பதொன் றில்.
translation: Nothing else lasts on earth for e'er  Saving high fame of the giver!
transliteration:
Ondraa Ulakaththu Uyarndha Pukazhallaal
Pondraadhu Nirpadhon Ril
explanation: There is nothing that stands forth in the world imperishable, except fame, exalted in solitary greatness

text:
நிலவரை நீள்புகழ் ஆற்றின் புலவரைப்
போற்றாது புத்தேள் உலகு.
translation: From hailing gods heavens will cease  To hail the men of lasting praise
transliteration:
Nilavarai Neelpukazh Aatrin Pulavaraip
Potraadhu Puththel Ulaku
explanation: If one has acquired extensive fame within the limits of this earth, the world of the Gods will no longer praise those sages who have attained that world

text:
நத்தம்போல் கேடும் உளதாகும் சாக்காடும்
வித்தகர்க் கல்லால் அரிது.
translation: Fame in fall and life in death  Are rare but for the soulful worth
transliteration:
Naththampol Ketum Uladhaakum Saakkaatum
Viththakark Kallaal Aridhu
explanation: Prosperity to the body of fame, resulting in poverty to the body of flesh and the stability to the former arising from the death of the latter, are achievable only by the wise

text:
தோன்றின் புகழொடு தோன்றுக அஃதிலார்
தோன்றலின் தோன்றாமை நன்று.
translation: Be born with fame if birth you want  If not of birth you must not vaunt
transliteration:
Thondrin Pukazhotu Thondruka Aqdhilaar
Thondralin Thondraamai Nandru
explanation: If you are born (in this world), be born with qualities conductive to fame From those who are destitute of them it will be better not to be born

text:
புகழ்பட வாழாதார் தந்நோவார் தம்மை
இகழ்வாரை நோவது எவன்?
translation: Why grieve at those who blame the shame  Of those who cannot live in fame?
transliteration:
Pukazhpata Vaazhaadhaar Thannovaar Thammai
Ikazhvaarai Novadhu Evan?
explanation: Why do those who cannot live with praise, grieve those who despise them, instead of grieving themselves for their own inability

text:
வசையென்ப வையத்தார்க் கெல்லாம் இசையென்னும்
எச்சம் பெறாஅ விடின்.
translation: To men on earth it is a shame  Not to beget the child of fame
transliteration:
Vasaiyenpa Vaiyaththaark Kellaam Isaiyennum
Echcham Peraaa Vitin
explanation: Not to beget fame will be esteemed a disgrace by the wise in this world

text:
வசையிலா வண்பயன் குன்றும் இசையிலா
யாக்கை பொறுத்த நிலம்.
translation: The land will shrink in yield if men  O'erburden it without renown
transliteration:
Vasaiyilaa Vanpayan Kundrum Isaiyilaa
Yaakkai Poruththa Nilam
explanation: The ground which supports a body without fame will diminish in its rich produce

text:
வசையொழிய வாழ்வாரே வாழ்வார் இசையொழிய
வாழ்வாரே வாழா தவர்.
translation: They live who live without blemish  The blameful ones do not flurish
transliteration:
Vasaiyozhiya Vaazhvaare Vaazhvaar Isaiyozhiya
Vaazhvaare Vaazhaa Thavar
explanation: Those live who live without disgrace Those who live without fame live not

text:
அருட்செல்வம் செல்வத்துள் செல்வம் பொருட்செல்வம்
பூரியார் கண்ணும் உள.
translation: The wealth of wealth is wealth of grace  Earthly wealth e'en the basest has
transliteration:
Arutchelvam Selvaththul Selvam Porutchelvam
Pooriyaar Kannum Ula
explanation: The wealth of kindness is wealth of wealth, in as much as the wealth of property is possessed by the basest of men

text:
நல்லாற்றாள் நாடி அருளாள்க பல்லாற்றால்
தேரினும் அஃதே துணை.
translation: Seek by sound ways good compassion;  All faiths mark that for-salvation
transliteration:
Nallaatraal Naati Arulaalka Pallaatraal
Therinum Aqdhe Thunai
explanation: (Stand) in the good path, consider, and be kind. Even considering according to the conflicting tenets of the different sects, kindness will be your best aid, (in the acquisition of heavenly bliss.)

text:
அருள்சேர்ந்த நெஞ்சினார்க் கில்லை இருள்சேர்ந்த
இன்னா உலகம் புகல்.
translation: The hearts of mercy shall not go  Into dark worlds of gruesome woe
transliteration:
Arulserndha Nenjinaark Killai Irulserndha
Innaa Ulakam Pukal
explanation: They will never enter the world of darkness and wretchedness whose minds are the abode of kindness

text:
மன்னுயிர் ஓம்பி அருளாள்வார்க்கு இல்லென்ப
தன்னுயிர் அஞ்சும் வினை.
translation: His soul is free from dread of sins  Whose mercy serveth all beings
transliteration:
Mannuyir Ompi Arulaalvaarkku Illenpa
Thannuyir Anjum Vinai
explanation: (The wise) say that the evils, which his soul would dread, will never come upon the man who exercises kindness and protects the life (of other creatures)

text:
அல்லல் அருளாள்வார்க்கு இல்லை வளிவழங்கும்
மல்லன்மா ஞாலங் கரி.
translation: The wide wind-fed world witness bears:  Men of mercy meet not sorrows
transliteration:
Allal Arulaalvaarkku Illai Valivazhangum
Mallanmaa Gnaalang Kari
explanation: This great rich earth over which the wind blows, is a witness that sorrow never comes upon the kindhearted

text:
பொருள்நீங்கிப் பொச்சாந்தார் என்பர் அருள்நீங்கி
அல்லவை செய்தொழுகு வார்.
translation: Who grace forsake and graceless act  The former loss and woes forget
transliteration:
Porulneengip Pochchaandhaar Enpar Arulneengi
Allavai Seydhozhuku Vaar
explanation: (The wise) say that those who neglect kindness and practise cruelties, neglected virtue (in their former birth), and forgot (the sorrows which they must suffer.)

text:
அருளில்லார்க்கு அவ்வுலகம் இல்லை பொருளில்லார்க்கு
இவ்வுலகம் இல்லாகி யாங்கு.
translation: This world is not for weathless ones  That world is not for graceless swines
transliteration:
Arulillaarkku Avvulakam Illai Porulillaarkku
Ivvulakam Illaaki Yaangu
explanation: As this world is not for those who are without wealth, so that world is not for those who are without kindness

text:
பொருளற்றார் பூப்பர் ஒருகால் அருளற்றார்
அற்றார்மற் றாதல் அரிது.
translation: The wealthless may prosper one day;  The graceless never bloom agay
transliteration:
Porulatraar Pooppar Orukaal Arulatraar
Atraarmar Raadhal Aridhu
explanation: Those who are without wealth may, at some future time, become prosperous; those who are destitute of kindness are utterly destitute; for them there is no change

text:
தெருளாதான் மெய்ப்பொருள் கண்டற்றால் தேரின்
அருளாதான் செய்யும் அறம்.
translation: Like Truth twisted by confused mind  Wisdom is vain in hearts unkind
transliteration:
Therulaadhaan Meypporul Kantatraal Therin
Arulaadhaan Seyyum Aram
explanation: If you consider, the virtue of him who is without kindness is like the perception of the true being by him who is without wisdom

text:
வலியார்முன் தன்னை நினைக்க தான் தன்னின்
மெலியார்மேல் செல்லு மிடத்து.
translation: Think how you feel before the strong  When to the feeble you do wrong
transliteration:
Valiyaarmun Thannai Ninaikka Thaan
Thannin Meliyaarmel Sellu Mitaththu
explanation: When a man is about to rush upon those who are weaker than himself, let him remember how he has stood (trembling) before those who are stronger than himself

text:
தன்னூன் பெருக்கற்குத் தான்பிறிது ஊனுண்பான்
எங்ஙனம் ஆளும் அருள்?
translation: What graciousness can one command  who feeds his flesh by flesh gourmand
transliteration:
Thannoon Perukkarkuth Thaanpiridhu Oonunpaan
Engnganam Aalum Arul?
explanation: How can he be possessed of kindness, who to increase his own flesh, eats the flesh of other creatures

text:
பொருளாட்சி போற்றாதார்க்கு இல்லை அருளாட்சி
ஆங்கில்லை ஊன்தின் பவர்க்கு.
translation: The thriftless have no property  And flesh-eaters have no pity
transliteration:
Porulaatchi Potraadhaarkku Illai Arulaatchi
Aangillai Oondhin Pavarkku
explanation: As those possess no property who do not take care of it, so those possess no kindness who feed on flesh

text:
படைகொண்டார் நெஞ்சம்போல் நன்னூக்காது ஒன்றன்
உடல்சுவை உண்டார் மனம்.
translation: Who wields a steel is steel-hearted  Who tastes body is hard-hearted
transliteration:
Pataikontaar Nenjampol Nannookkaadhu Ondran
Utalsuvai Untaar Manam
explanation: Like the (murderous) mind of him who carries a weapon (in his hand), the mind of him who feasts with pleasure on the body of another (creature), has no regard for goodness

text:
ருளல்லது யாதெனின் கொல்லாமை கோறல்
பொருளல்லது அவ்வூன் தினல்.
translation: If merciless it is to kill,  To kill and eat is disgraceful
transliteration:
Arulalladhu Yaadhenin Kollaamai Koral
Porulalladhu Avvoon Thinal
explanation: If it be asked what is kindness and what its opposite, the answer would be preservation and destruction of life; and therefore it is not right to feed on the flesh (obtained by taking away life)

text:
உண்ணாமை உள்ளது உயிர்நிலை ஊனுண்ண
அண்ணாத்தல் செய்யாது அளறு.
translation: Off with flesh; a life you save  The eater hell's mouth shall not waive!
transliteration:
Unnaamai Ulladhu Uyirnilai Oonunna
Annaaththal Seyyaadhu Alaru
explanation: Not to eat flesh contributes to the continuance of life; therefore if a man eat flesh, hell will not open its mouth (to let him escape out, after he has once fallen in)

text:
தினற்பொருட்டால் கொல்லாது உலகெனின் யாரும்
விலைப்பொருட்டால் ஊன்றருவா ரில்.
translation: None would kill and sell the flesh  For eating it if they don't wish
transliteration:
Thinarporuttaal Kollaadhu Ulakenin Yaarum
Vilaipporuttaal Oondraruvaa Ril
explanation: If the world does not destroy life for the purpose of eating, then no one would sell flesh for the sake of money

text:
உண்ணாமை வேண்டும் புலாஅல் பிறிதொன்றன்
புண்ணது உணர்வார்ப் பெறின்.
translation: From eating flesh men must abstain  If they but feel the being's pain
transliteration:
Unnaamai Ventum Pulaaal Piridhondran
Punnadhu Unarvaarp Perin
explanation: If men should come to know that flesh is nothing but the unclean ulcer of a body, let them abstain from eating it

text:
செயிரின் தலைப்பிரிந்த காட்சியார் உண்ணார்
உயிரின் தலைப்பிரிந்த ஊன்.
translation: Whose mind from illusion is freed  Refuse on lifeless flesh to feed
transliteration:
Seyirin Thalaippirindha Kaatchiyaar Unnaar
Uyirin Thalaippirindha Oon
explanation: The wise, who have freed themselves from mental delusion, will not eat the flesh which has been severed from an animal

text:
அவிசொரிந் தாயிரம் வேட்டலின் ஒன்றன்
உயிர்செகுத் துண்ணாமை நன்று.
translation: Not to-kill-and-eat, truly  Excels thousand pourings of ghee!
transliteration:
Avisorin Thaayiram Vettalin Ondran
Uyirsekuth Thunnaamai Nandru
explanation: Not to kill and eat (the flesh of) an animal, is better than the pouring forth of ghee etc, in a thousand sacrifices

text:
கொல்லான் புலாலை மறுத்தானைக் கைகூப்பி
எல்லா உயிருந் தொழும்.
translation: All lives shall lift their palms to him  Who eats not flesh nor kills with whim
transliteration:
Kollaan Pulaalai Maruththaanaik Kaikooppi
Ellaa Uyirun Thozhum
explanation: All creatures will join their hands together, and worship him who has never taken away life, nor eaten flesh

text:
உற்றநோய் நோன்றல் உயிர்க்குறுகண் செய்யாமை
அற்றே தவத்திற் குரு.
translation: Pains endure; pain not beings  This is the type of true penance
transliteration:
Utranoi Nondral Uyirkkurukan Seyyaamai
Atre Thavaththir Kuru
explanation: The nature of religious discipline consists, in the endurance (by the ascetic) of the sufferings which it brings on himself, and in abstaining from giving pain to others

text:
தவமும் தவமுடையார்க்கு ஆகும் அதனை
அஃதிலார் மேற்கொள் வது.
translation: Penance is fit for penitents  Not for him who in vain pretends
transliteration:
Thavamum Thavamutaiyaarkku Aakum Adhanai
Aqdhilaar Merkol Vadhu
explanation: Austerities can only be borne, and their benefits enjoyed, by those who have practised them (in a former birth); it will be useless for those who have not done so, to attempt to practise them (now)

text:
துறந்தார்க்குத் துப்புரவு வேண்டி மறந்தார்கொல்
மற்றை யவர்கள் தவம்.
translation: Is it to true penitent's aid,  That others austere path avoid?
transliteration:
Thurandhaarkkuth Thuppuravu Venti Marandhaarkol
Matrai Yavarkal Thavam
explanation: It is to provide food etc, for the ascetics who have abandoned (the desire of earthly possessions) that other persons have forgotten (to practise) austerity ?

text:
ஒன்னார்த் தெறலும் உவந்தாரை ஆக்கலும்
எண்ணின் தவத்தான் வரும்.
translation: In penance lies the power to save  The friends and foil the foe and knave
transliteration:
Onnaarth Theralum Uvandhaarai Aakkalum
Ennin Thavaththaan Varum
explanation: If (the ascetic) desire the destruction of his enemies, or the aggrandizement of his friends, it will be effected by (the power of) his austerities

text:
வேண்டிய வேண்டியாங் கெய்தலால் செய்தவம்
ஈண்டு முயலப் படும்.
translation: What they wish as they wish is won  Here hence by men penance is done
transliteration:
Ventiya Ventiyaang Keydhalaal Seydhavam
Eentu Muyalap Patum
explanation: Religious dislipline is practised in this world, because it secures the attainment of whatever one may wish to enjoy (in the world to come)

text:
தவஞ் செய்வார் தங்கருமஞ் செய்வார்மற் றல்லார்
அவஞ்செய்வார் ஆசையுட் பட்டு.
translation: Who do penance achieve their aim  Others desire-rid themselves harm
transliteration:
Thavanj Cheyvaar Thangarumanj Cheyvaarmar
Rallaar Avanjeyvaar Aasaiyut Pattu
explanation: Those discharge their duty who perform austerities; all others accomplish their own destruction, through the entanglement of the desire (of riches and sensual pleasure)

text:
சுடச்சுடரும் பொன்போல் ஒளிவிடும் துன்பஞ்
சுடச்சுட நோற்கிற் பவர்க்கு.
translation: Pure and bright gets the gold in fire;  and so the life by pain austere
transliteration:
Sutachchutarum Ponpol Olivitum Thunpanjjch
Utachchuta Norkir Pavarkku
explanation: Just as gold is purified as heated in the fire, will those shine, who have endured the burning of pain (in frequent austerities)

text:
தன்னுயிர் தான்அறப் பெற்றானை ஏனைய
மன்னுயி ரெல்லாந் தொழும்.
translation: He worship wins from every soul  Who Master is by soul control
transliteration:
Thannuyir Thaanarap Petraanai Enaiya
Mannuyi Rellaan Thozhum
explanation: All other creatures will worship him who has attained the control of his own soul

text:
கூற்றம் குதித்தலும் கைகூடும் நோற்றலின்
ஆற்றல் தலைப்பட் டவர்க்குல்.
translation: They can even defy death  Who get by penance godly strenth
transliteration:
Kootram Kudhiththalum Kaikootum Notralin
Aatral Thalaippat Tavarkkul
explanation: Those who have attained the power which religious discipline confers, will be able also to pass the limit of Yama, (the God of death)

text:
இலர்பல ராகிய காரணம் நோற்பார்
சிலர்பலர் நோலா தவர்.
translation: Many are poor and few are rich  For they care not for penance much
transliteration:
Ilarpala Raakiya Kaaranam Norpaar
Silarpalar Nolaa Thavar
explanation: Because there are few who practise austerity and many who do not, there are many destitute and few rich in this world

text:
வஞ்ச மனத்தான் படிற்றொழுக்கம் பூதங்கள்
ஐந்தும் அகத்தே நகும்.
translation: Elements five of feigned life  Of a sly hypocrite within laugh
transliteration:
Vanja Manaththaan Patitrozhukkam Poodhangal
Aindhum Akaththe Nakum
explanation: The five elements (of his body) will laugh within him at the feigned conduct of the deceitful minded man

text:
வானுயர் தோற்றம் எவன்செய்யும் தன்னெஞ்சம்
தான்அறி குற்றப் படின்.
translation: Of what avail are sky-high shows  When guild the conscience gnaws and knows
transliteration:
Vaanuyar Thotram Evanseyyum Thannenjam
Thaanari Kutrap Patin
explanation: What avails an appearance (of sanctity) high as heaven, if his mind suffers (the indulgence) of conscious sin

text:
வலியில் நிலைமையான் வல்லுருவம் பெற்றம்
புலியின்தோல் போர்த்துமேய்ந் தற்று.
translation: Vaunting sainthood while week within  Seems a grazer with tiger skin
transliteration:
Valiyil Nilaimaiyaan Valluruvam Petram
Puliyindhol Porththumeyn Thatru
explanation: The assumed appearance of power, by a man who has no power (to restrain his senses and perform austerity), is like a cow feeding on grass covered with a tiger's skin

text:
தவமறைந்து அல்லவை செய்தல் புதல்மறைந்து
வேட்டுவன் புள்சிமிழ்த் தற்று.
translation: Sinning in saintly show is like  Fowlers in ambush birds to strike
transliteration:
Thavamaraindhu Allavai Seydhal Pudhalmaraindhu
Vettuvan Pulsimizhth Thatru
explanation: He who hides himself under the mask of an ascetic and commits sins, like a sportsman who conceals himself in the thicket to catch birds

text:
பற்றற்றேம் என்பார் படிற்றொழுக்கம் எற்றெற்றென்று
ஏதம் பலவுந் தரும்.
translation: Who false within but freedom feign  Shall moan \"What have we done\" with pain
transliteration:
Patratrem Enpaar Patitrozhukkam Etretrendru
Edham Palavun Tharum
explanation: The false conduct of those who say they have renounced all desire will one day bring them sorrows that will make them cry out, "Oh! what have we done, what have we done."

text:
நெஞ்சின் துறவார் துறந்தார்போல் வஞ்சித்து
வாழ்வாரின் வன்கணார் இல்.
translation: Vilest is he who seems a saint  Cheating the world without restraint
transliteration:
Nenjin Thuravaar Thurandhaarpol Vanjiththu
Vaazhvaarin Vankanaar Il
explanation: Amongst living men there are none so hard-hearted as those who without to saking (desire) in their heart, falsely take the appearance of those who have forsaken (it)

text:
புறங்குன்றி கண்டனைய ரேனும் அகங்குன்றி
முக்கிற் கரியார் உடைத்து.
translation: Berry-red is his outward view,  Black like its nose his inward hue
transliteration:
Purangundri Kantanaiya Renum Akangundri
Mukkir Kariyaar Utaiththu
explanation: (The world) contains persons whose outside appears (as fair) as the (red) berry of the Abrus, but whose inside is as black as the nose of that berry

text:
மனத்தது மாசாக மாண்டார் நீராடி
மறைந்தொழுகு மாந்தர் பலர்.
translation: Filthy in mind some bathe in streams  Hiding sins in showy extremes
transliteration:
Manaththadhu Maasaaka Maantaar Neeraati
Maraindhozhuku Maandhar Palar
explanation: There are many men of masked conduct, who perform their ablutions, and (make a show) of

text:
கணைகொடிது யாழ்கோடு செவ்விதுஆங் கன்ன
வினைபடு பாலால் கொளல்.
translation: Know men by acts and not by forms  Strait arrow kills, bent lute but charms
transliteration:
Kanaikotidhu Yaazhkotu Sevvidhuaang Kanna
Vinaipatu Paalaal Kolal
explanation: As, in its use, the arrow is crooked, and the curved lute is straight, so by their deeds, (and not by their appearance) let (the uprightness or crookedness of) men be estimated

text:
மழித்தலும் நீட்டலும் வேண்டா உலகம்
பழித்தது ஒழித்து விடின்.
translation: No balding nor tangling the hair!  Abstain from condemned acts with care
transliteration:
Mazhiththalum Neettalum Ventaa Ulakam
Pazhiththadhu Ozhiththu Vitin
explanation: There is no need of a shaven crown, nor of tangled hair, if a man abstain from those deeds which the wise have condemned

text:
எள்ளாமை வேண்டுவான் என்பான் எனைத்தொன்றும்
கள்ளாமை காக்கதன் நெஞ்சு.
translation: Let him who would reproachless be  From all frauds guard his conscience free
transliteration:
Ellaamai Ventuvaan Enpaan Enaiththondrum
Kallaamai Kaakkadhan Nenju
explanation: Let him, who desires not to be despised, keep his mind from (the desire of) defrauding another of the smallest thing

text:
உள்ளத்தால் உள்ளலும் தீதே பிறன்பொருளைக்
கள்ளத்தால் கள்வேம் எனல்.
translation: \"We will by fraud win other's wealth\"  Even this thought is sin and stealth
transliteration:
Ullaththaal Ullalum Theedhe Piranporulaik
Kallaththaal Kalvem Enal
explanation: Even the thought (of sin) is sin; think not then of crafiily stealing the property of another

text:
களவினால் ஆகிய ஆக்கம் அளவிறந்து
ஆவது போலக் கெடும்.
translation: The gain by fraud may overflow  But swift to ruin it shall go
transliteration:
Kalavinaal Aakiya Aakkam Alavirandhu
Aavadhu Polak Ketum
explanation: The property, which is acquired by fraud, will entirely perish, even while it seems to increase

text:
களவின்கண் கன்றிய காதல் விளைவின்கண்
வீயா விழுமம் தரும்.
translation: The fruit that fraud and greed obtain  Shall end in endless grief and pain
transliteration:
Kalavinkan Kandriya Kaadhal Vilaivinkan
Veeyaa Vizhumam Tharum
explanation: The eager desire of defrauding others will, when it brings forth its fruit, produce undying sorrow

text:
அருள்கருதி அன்புடைய ராதல் பொருள்கருதிப்
பொச்சாப்புப் பார்ப்பார்கண் இல்.
translation: Love and Grace are not their worth  Who watch to waylay dozer's wealth
transliteration:
Arulkarudhi Anputaiya Raadhal Porulkarudhip
Pochchaappup Paarppaarkan Il
explanation: The study of kindness and the exercise of benevolence is not with those who watch for another's forgetfulness, though desire of his property

text:
அளவின்கண் நின்றொழுகல் ஆற்றார் களவின்கண்
கன்றிய காத லவர்.
translation: They cannot walk in measured bounds  who crave and have covetous ends
transliteration:
Alavinkan Nindrozhukal Aatraar Kalavinkan
Kandriya Kaadha Lavar
explanation: They cannot walk steadfastly, according to rule, who eagerly desire to defraud others

text:
களவென்னும் காரறி வாண்மை அளவென்னும்
ஆற்றல் புரிந்தார்கண்ட இல்.
translation: Men of measured wisdom shun  Black art of fraud and what it won
transliteration:
Kalavennum Kaarari Vaanmai Alavennum
Aatral Purindhaarkanta Il
explanation: That black-knowledge which is called fraud, is not in those who desire that greatness which is called rectitude

text:
அளவற஧ந்தார் நெஞ்சத் தறம்போல நிற்கும்
களவறிந்தார் நெஞ்சில் கரவு.
translation: Virtue abides in righteous hearts  Into minds of frauds deceit darts
transliteration:
Alavarindhaar Nenjath Tharampola Nirkum
Kalavarindhaar Nenjil Karavu
explanation: Deceit dwells in the mind of those who are conversant with fraud, even as virtue in the minds of those who are conversant with rectitude

text:
அளவல்ல செய்தாங்கே வீவர் களவல்ல
மற்றைய தேற்றா தவர்.
translation: They perish in their perfidy  Who know nothing but pilfery
transliteration:
Alavalla Seydhaange Veevar Kalavalla
Matraiya Thetraa Thavar
explanation: Those, who are acquainted with nothing but fraud, will perish in the very commission of transgression

text:
கள்வார்க்குத் தள்ளும் உயிர்நிலை கள்வார்க்குத்
தள்ளாது புத்தே ளுளகு.
translation: Even the body rejects thieves;  The honest men, heaven receives
transliteration:
Kalvaarkkuth Thallum Uyirnilai Kalvaarkkuth
Thallaadhu Puththe Lulaku
explanation: Even their body will fail the fraudulent; but even the world of the gods will not fail those who are free from fraud

text:
வாய்மை எனப்படுவது யாதெனின் யாதொன்றும்
தீமை இலாத சொலல்.
translation: If \"What is truth\"? the question be,  It is to speak out evil-free
transliteration:
Vaaimai Enappatuvadhu Yaadhenin Yaadhondrum
Theemai Ilaadha Solal
explanation: Truth is the speaking of such words as are free from the least degree of evil (to others)

text:
பொய்மையும் வாய்மை யிடத்த புரைதீர்ந்த
நன்மை பயக்கும் எனின்.
translation: E'en falsehood may for truth suffice,  When good it brings removing vice
transliteration:
Poimaiyum Vaaimai Yitaththa Puraidheerndha
Nanmai Payakkum Enin
explanation: Even falsehood has the nature of truth, if it confer a benefit that is free from fault

text:
தன்நெஞ் சறிவது பொய்யற்க பொய்த்தபின்
தன்நெஞ்சே தன்னைச் சுடும்.
translation: Let not a man knowingly lie;  Conscience will scorch and make him sigh
transliteration:
Thannenj Charivadhu Poiyarka Poiththapin
Thannenje Thannaich Chutum
explanation: Let not a man knowingly tell a lie; for after he has told the lie, his mind will burn him (with the memory of his guilt)

text:
உள்ளத்தாற் பொய்யா தொழுகின் உலகத்தார்
உள்ளத்து ளெல்லாம் உளன்.
translation: He lives in loving hearts of all  Who serves the Truth serene in soul
transliteration:
Ullaththaar Poiyaa Thozhukin Ulakaththaar
Ullaththu Lellaam Ulan
explanation: He who, in his conduct, preserves a mind free from deceit, will dwell in the minds of all men

text:
மனத்தொடு வாய்மை மொழியின் தவத்தொடு
தானஞ்செய் வாரின் தலை.
translation: To speak the truth from heart sincere  Is more than giving and living austere
transliteration:
Manaththotu Vaaimai Mozhiyin Thavaththotu
Thaananjey Vaarin Thalai
explanation: He, who speaks truth with all his heart, is superior to those who make gifts and practise austerities

text:
பொய்யாமை அன்ன புகழில்லை எய்யாமை
எல்லா அறமுந் தரும்.
translation: Not to lie brings all the praise  All virtues from Truth arise
transliteration:
Poiyaamai Anna Pukazhillai Eyyaamai
Ellaa Aramun Tharum
explanation: There is no praise like the praise of never uttering a falsehood: without causing any suffering, it will lead to every virtue

text:
பொய்யாமை பொய்யாமை ஆற்றின் அறம்பிற
செய்யாமை செய்யாமை நன்று.
translation: Lie not lie not Naught else you need  All virtues are in Truth indeed
transliteration:
Poiyaamai Poiyaamai Aatrin Arampira
Seyyaamai Seyyaamai Nandru
explanation: If a man has the power to abstain from falsehood, it will be well with him, even though he practise no other virtue

text:
புறள்தூய்மை நீரான் அமையும் அகந்தூய்மை
வாய்மையால் காணப் படும்.
translation: Water makes you pure outward  Truth renders you pure inward
transliteration:
Puraldhooimai Neeraan Amaiyum Akandhooimai
Vaaimaiyaal Kaanap Patum
explanation: Purity of body is produced by water and purity of mind by truthfulness

text:
எல்லா விளக்கும் விளக்கல்ல சான்றோர்க்குப்
பொய்யா விளக்கே விளக்கு.
translation: All lights are not lights for the wise;  Truth light is light bright like Sun-light
transliteration:
Ellaa Vilakkum Vilakkalla Saandrorkkup
Poiyaa Vilakke Vilakku
explanation: All lamps of nature are not lamps; the lamp of truth is the lamp of the wise

text:
யாமெய்யாக் கண்டவற்றுள் இல்லை எனைத்தொன்றும்
வாய்மையின் நல்ல பிற.
translation: Of all the things we here have seen  Nothing surpasses Truth serene!
transliteration:
Yaameyyaak Kantavatrul Illai Enaiththondrum
Vaaimaiyin Nalla Pira
explanation: Amidst all that we have seen (described) as real (excellence), there is nothing so good as truthfulness

text:
செல்லிடத்துக் காப்பான் சினங்காப்பான் அல்லிடத்துக்
காக்கின்என் காவாக்கால் என்?
translation: Anger against the weak is wrong  It is futile against the strong
transliteration:
Sellitaththuk Kaappaan Sinangaappaan Allitaththuk
Kaakkinen Kaavaakkaal En?
explanation: He restrains his anger who restrains it when it can injure; when it cannot injure, what does it matter whether he restrain it, or not ?

text:
செல்லா இடத்துச் சினந்தீது செல்லிடத்தும்
இல்அதனின் தீய பிற.
translation: Vain is wrath against men of force  Against the meek it is still worse
transliteration:
Sellaa Itaththuch Chinandheedhu Sellitaththum
Iladhanin Theeya Pira
explanation: Anger is bad, even when it cannot injure; when it can injure; there is no greater evil

text:
மறத்தல் வெகுளியை யார்மாட்டும் தீய
பிறத்தல் அதனான் வரும்.
translation: Off with wrath with any one  It is the source of sin and pain
transliteration:
Maraththal Vekuliyai Yaarmaattum Theeya
Piraththal Adhanaan Varum
explanation: Forget anger towards every one, as fountains of evil spring from it

text:
நகையும் உவகையும் கொல்லும் சினத்தின்
பகையும் உளவோ பிற.
translation: Is there a foe like harmful ire  Which kills the smile and joyful cheer?
transliteration:
Nakaiyum Uvakaiyum Kollum Sinaththin
Pakaiyum Ulavo Pira
explanation: What other foe to man works such annoy?

text:
தன்னைத்தான் காக்கின் சினங்காக்க காவாக்கால்
தன்னையே கொல்லுஞ் சினம்.
translation: Thyself to save, from wrath away!  If not thyself the wrath will slay
transliteration:
Thannaiththaan Kaakkin Sinangaakka Kaavaakkaal
Thannaiye Kollunj Chinam
explanation: If a man would guard himself, let him guard against anger; if he do not guard it, anger will kill him

text:
சினமென்னும் சேர்ந்தாரைக் கொல்லி இனமென்னும்
ஏமப் புணையைச் சுடும்.
translation: Friend-killer is the fatal rage  It burns the helpful kinship-barge
transliteration:
Sinamennum Serndhaaraik Kolli Inamennum
Emap Punaiyaich Chutum
explanation: The fire of anger will burn up even the pleasant raft of friendship

text:
சினத்தைப் பொருளென்று கொண்டவன் கேடு
நிலத்தறைந்தான் கைபிழையா தற்று.
translation: The wrath-lover to doom is bound  Like failless-hand that strikes the ground
transliteration:
Sinaththaip Porulendru Kontavan Ketu
Nilaththaraindhaan Kaipizhaiyaa Thatru
explanation: Destruction will come upon him who ragards anger as a good thing, as surely as the hand of him who strikes the ground will not fail

text:
இணர்எரி தோய்வன்ன இன்னா செயினும்
புணரின் வெகுளாமை நன்று.
translation: Save thy soul from burning ire  Though tortured like the touch of fire
transliteration:
Inareri Thoivanna Innaa Seyinum
Punarin Vekulaamai Nandru
explanation: Though one commit things against you as painful (to bear) as if a bundle of fire had been thrust upon you, it will be well, to refrain, if possible, from anger

text:
உள்ளிய தெல்லாம் உடனெய்தும் உள்ளத்தால்
உள்ளான் வெகுளி எனின்.
translation: Wishes he gains as he wishes  If man refrains from rage vicious!
transliteration:
Ulliya Thellaam Utaneydhum Ullaththaal
Ullaan Vekuli Enin
explanation: If a man never indulges anger in his heart, he will at once obtain whatever he has thought of

text:
இறந்தார் இறந்தார் அனையர் சினத்தைத்
துறந்தார் துறந்தார் துணை.
translation: Dead are they who are anger-fed  Saints are they from whom wrath has fled
transliteration:
Irandhaar Irandhaar Anaiyar Sinaththaith
Thurandhaar Thurandhaar Thunai
explanation: Those, who give way to excessive anger, are no better than dead men; but those, who are freed from it, are equal to those who are freed (from death)

text:
சிறப்பீனும் செல்வம் பெறினும் பிறர்க்கு இன்னா
செய்யாமை மாசற்றார் கோள்.
translation: The pure by faith mean pain to none  Though princely wealth by that is won
transliteration:
Sirappeenum Selvam Perinum Pirarkku
Innaa Seyyaamai Maasatraar Kol
explanation: It is the determination of the spotless not to cause sorrow to others, although they could (by so causing) obtain the wealth which confers greatness

text:
கறுத்துஇன்னா செய்தவக் கண்ணும் மறுத்தின்னா
செய்யாமை மாசற்றார் கோள்.
translation: The spotless hearts seek not revenge  Though Malice does the worst in rage
transliteration:
Karuththuinnaa Seydhavak Kannum Maruththinnaa
Seyyaamai Maasatraar Kol
explanation: It is the determination of the spotless not to do evil, even in return, to those who have cherished enmity and done them evil

text:
செய்யாமல் செற்றார்க்கும் இன்னாத செய்தபின்
உய்யா விழுமந் தரும்.
translation: Revenging even causeless hate  Bad-blood breeds and baneful heat
transliteration:
Seyyaamal Setraarkkum Innaadha Seydhapin
Uyyaa Vizhuman Tharum
explanation: In an ascetic inflict suffering even on those who hate him, when he has not done them any evil, it will afterwards give him irretrievable sorrow

text:
இன்னாசெய் தாரை ஒறுத்தல் அவர்நாண
நன்னயஞ் செய்து விடல்.
translation: Doing good-turns, put them to shame  Thus chide the evil who do harm
transliteration:
Innaasey Thaarai Oruththal Avarnaana
Nannayanj Cheydhu Vital
explanation: The (proper) punishment to those who have done evil (to you), is to put them to shame by showing them kindness, in return and to forget both the evil and the good done on both sides

text:
அறிவினான் ஆகுவ துண்டோ பிறிதின்நோய்
தந்நோய்போல் போற்றாக் கடை.
translation: What does a man from wisdom gain  If he pines not at other's pain?
transliteration:
Arivinaan Aakuva Thunto Piridhinnoi
Thannoipol Potraak Katai
explanation: What benefit has he derived from his knowledge, who does not endeavour to keep off pain from another as much as from himself ?

text:
இன்னா எனத்தான் உணர்ந்தவை துன்னாமை
வேண்டும் பிறன்கண் செயல்.
translation: What you feel as pain to yourself  Do it not to the other-self
transliteration:
Innaa Enaththaan Unarndhavai Thunnaamai
Ventum Pirankan Seyal
explanation: Let not a man consent to do those things to another which, he knows, will cause sorrow

text:
எனைத்தானும் எஞ்ஞான்றும் யார்க்கும் மனத்தானாம்
மாணாசெய் யாமை தலை.
translation: Any, anywhere injure not  At any time even in thought
transliteration:
Enaiththaanum Egngnaandrum Yaarkkum Manaththaanaam
Maanaasey Yaamai Thalai
explanation: It is the chief of all virtues not knowingly to do any person evil, even in the lowest degree, and at any time

text:
தன்னுயிர்ககு ஏன்னாமை தானறிவான் என்கொலோ
மன்னுயிர்க்கு இன்னா செயல்.
translation: How can he injure other souls  Who in his life injury feels
transliteration:
Thannuyirkaku Ennaamai Thaanarivaan Enkolo
Mannuyirkku Innaa Seyal
explanation: Why does a man inflict upon other creatures those sufferings, which he has found by experience are sufferings to himself ?

text:
பிறர்க்கின்னா முற்பகல் செய்யின் தமக்கு இன்னா
பிற்பகல் தாமே வரும்.
translation: Harm others in the forenoon  Harm seeks thee in afternoon
transliteration:
Pirarkkinnaa Murpakal Seyyin Thamakku
Innaa Pirpakal Thaame Varum
explanation: If a man inflict sorrow upon others in the morning, it will come upon him unsought in the very evening

text:
நோயெல்லாம் நோய்செய்தார் மேலவாம் நோய்செய்யார்
நோயின்மை வேண்டு பவர்.
translation: No harm is done by peace-lovers  For pains rebound on pain-givers
transliteration:
Noyellaam Noiseydhaar Melavaam Noiseyyaar
Noyinmai Ventu Pavar
explanation: Sorrow will come upon those who cause pain to others; therfore those, who desire to be free from sorrow, give no pain to others

text:
அறவினை யாதெனின் கொல்லாமை கோறல்
பிறவினை எல்லாந் தரும்.
translation: What is Virtue? 'Tis not to kill  For killing causes every ill
transliteration:
Aravinai Yaadhenin Kollaamai Koral
Piravinai Ellaan Tharum
explanation: Never to destroy life is the sum of all virtuous conduct The destruction of life leads to every evil

text:
பகுத்துண்டு பல்லுயிர் ஓம்புதல் நூலோர்
தொகுத்தவற்றுள் எல்லாந் தலை.
translation: Share the food and serve all lives  This is the law of all the laws
transliteration:
Pakuththuntu Palluyir Ompudhal Noolor
Thokuththavatrul Ellaan Thalai
explanation: The chief of all (the virtues) which authors have summed up, is the partaking of food that has been shared with others, and the preservation of the mainfold life of other creatures

text:
ஒன்றாக நல்லது கொல்லாமை மற்றதன்
பின்சாரப் பொய்யாமை நன்று.
translation: Not to kill is unique good  The next, not to utter falsehood
transliteration:
Ondraaka Nalladhu Kollaamai Matradhan
Pinsaarap Poiyaamai Nandru
explanation: Not to destroy life is an incomparably (great) good next to it in goodness ranks freedom from falsehood

text:
நல்லாறு எனப்படுவது யாதெனின் யாதொன்றும்
கொல்லாமை சூழும் நெறி.
translation: What way is good? That we can say  The way away from heat to slay
transliteration:
Nallaaru Enappatuvadhu Yaadhenin Yaadhondrum
Kollaamai Soozhum Neri
explanation: Good path is that which considers how it may avoid killing any creature

text:
நிலைஅஞ்சி நீத்தாருள் எல்லாம் கொலைஅஞ்சிக்
கொல்லாமை சூழ்வான் தலை.
translation: Of saints who renounce birth-fearing  The head is he who dreads killing
transliteration:
Nilaianji Neeththaarul Ellaam Kolaianjik
Kollaamai Soozhvaan Thalai
explanation: Of all those who, fearing the permanence of earthly births, have abandoned desire, he is the chief who, fearing (the guilt of) murder, considers how he may avoid the destruction of life

text:
கொல்லாமை மேற்கொண் டொழுகுவான் வாழ்நாள்மேல்
செல்லாது உயிருண்ணுங் கூற்று.
translation: Life-eating-Death shall spare the breath  Of him who no life puts to death
transliteration:
Kollaamai Merkon Tozhukuvaan Vaazhnaalmel
Sellaadhu Uyirunnung Kootru
explanation: Yama, the destroyer of life, will not attack the life of him, who acts under the determination of never destroying life

text:
தன்னுயிர் நீப்பினும் செய்யற்க தான்பிறிது
இன்னுயிர் நீக்கும் வினை.
translation: Kill not life that others cherish  Even when your life must perish
transliteration:
Thannuyir Neeppinum Seyyarka Thaanpiridhu
Innuyir Neekkum Vinai
explanation: Let no one do that which would destroy the life of another, although he should by so doing, lose his own life

text:
நன்றாகும் ஆக்கம் பெரிதெனினும் சான்றோர்க்குக்
கொன்றாகும் ஆக்கங் கடை.
translation: The gain of slaughter is a vice  Though deemed good in sacrifice
transliteration:
Nandraakum Aakkam Peridheninum Saandrorkkuk
Kondraakum Aakkang Katai
explanation: The advantage which might flow from destroying life in sacrifice, is dishonourable to the wise (who renounced the world), even although it should be said to be productive of great good

text:
கொலைவினைய ராகிய மாக்கள் புலைவினையர்
புன்மை தெரிவா ரகத்து.
translation: Those who live by slaying are  Eaters of carrion bizarre!
transliteration:
Kolaivinaiya Raakiya Maakkal Pulaivinaiyar
Punmai Therivaa Rakaththu
explanation: To minds of them who what is vileness know

text:
உயிர் உடம்பின் நீக்கியார் என்ப செயிர் உடம்பின்
செல்லாத்தீ வாழ்க்கை யவர்.
translation: The loathsome poor sickly and sore  Are killers stained by blood before
transliteration:
Uyir Utampin Neekkiyaar Enpa
Seyir Utampin Sellaaththee Vaazhkkai
explanation: (The wise) will say that men of diseased bodies, who live in degradation and in poverty, are those who separated the life from the body of animals (in a former birth)

text:
நில்லாத வற்றை நிலையின என்றுணரும்
புல்லறி வாண்மை கடை.
translation: The worst of follies it is told  The fleeting as lasting to hold
transliteration:
Nillaadha Vatrai Nilaiyina Endrunarum
Pullari Vaanmai Katai
explanation: That ignorance which considers those things to be stable which are not so, is dishonourable (to the wise)

text:
கூத்தாட்டு அவைக் குழாத் தற்றே பெருஞ்செல்வம்
போக்கும் அதுவிளிந் தற்று.
translation: Like a drama-crowd wealth gathers  Like passing show its pride too goes
transliteration:
Kooththaattu Avaik Kuzhaath Thatre
Perunjelvam Pokkum Adhuvilin Thatru
explanation: The acquisition of wealth is like the gathering together of an assembly for a theatre; its expenditure is like the breaking up of that assembly

text:
அற்கா இயல்பிற்றுச் செல்வம் அதுபெற்றால்
அற்குப ஆங்கே செயல்.
translation: Wealth wanes away; but when it comes  Take care to do enduring things
transliteration:
Arkaa Iyalpitruch Chelvam Adhupetraal
Arkupa Aange Seyal
explanation: Wealth is perishable; let those who obtain it immediately practise those (virtues) which are imperishable

text:
நாளென ஒன்றுபோற் காட்டி உயிர் ஈரும்
வாளது உணர்வார்ப் பெறின்.
translation: The showy day is but a saw  Your life, know that, to file and gnaw
transliteration:
Naalena Ondrupor Kaatti Uyir
Eerum Vaaladhu Unarvaarp Perin
explanation: Time, which shows itself (to the ignorant) as if it were something (real) is in the estimation of the wise (only) a saw which cuts down life

text:
நாச்செற்று விக்குள்மேல் வாராமுன் நல்வினை
மேற்சென்று செய்யப் படும்
translation: Ere tongue benumbs and hiccough comes  Rise up to do good deeds betimes
transliteration:
Naachchetru Vikkulmel Vaaraamun Nalvinai
Mersendru Seyyap Patum
explanation: Let virtuous deeds be done quickly, before the hiccup comes making the tongue silent

text:
நெருநல் உளனொருவன் இன்றில்லை என்னும்
பெருமை உடைத்துஇவ் வுலகு.
translation: One was yesterday; not today!
transliteration:
Nerunal Ulanoruvan Indrillai Ennum
Perumai Utaiththuiv Vulaku
explanation: This world possesses the greatness that one who yesterday was is not today

text:
ஒருபொழுதும் வாழ்வது அறியார் கருதுப
கோடியும் அல்ல பல.
translation: Man knows not his next moment  On crores of things he is intent
transliteration:
Orupozhudhum Vaazhvadhu Ariyaar Karudhupa
Kotiyum Alla Pala
explanation: Innumerable are the thoughts which occupy the mind of (the unwise), who know not that they shall live another moment

text:
குடம்பை தனித்து ஒழியப் புள்பறந் தற்றே
உடம்பொடு உயிரிடை நட்பு.
translation: The soul from body any day  Like bird from egg-shell flies away
transliteration:
Kutampai Thaniththu Ozhiyap Pulparan
Thatre Utampotu Uyiritai Natpu
explanation: The love of the soul to the body is like (the love of) a bird to its egg which it flies away from and leaves empty

text:
உறங்கு வதுபோலுஞ் சாக்காடு உறங்கி
விழிப்பது போலும் பிறப்பு.
translation: Death is like a slumber deep  And birth like waking from that sleep
transliteration:
Urangu Vadhupolunj Chaakkaatu Urangi
Vizhippadhu Polum Pirappu
explanation: Death is like sleep; birth is like awaking from it

text:
புக்கில் அமைந்தின்று கொல்லோ உடம்பினுள்
துச்சில் இருந்த உயிர்க்கு.
translation: The life berthed in this body shows  A fixed home it never knows
transliteration:
Pukkil Amaindhindru Kollo Utampinul
Thuchchil Irundha Uyirkku
explanation: It seems as if the soul, which takes a temporary shelter in a body, had not attained a home

text:
யாதனின் யாதனின் நீங்கியான் நோதல்
அதனின் அதனின் இலன்.
translation: From what from what a man is free  From that, from that his torments flee
transliteration:
Yaadhanin Yaadhanin Neengiyaan Nodhal
Adhanin Adhanin Ilan
explanation: Whatever thing, a man has renounced, by that thing; he cannot suffer pain

text:
வேண்டின் உண் டாகத் துறக்க துறந்தபின்
ஈண்டுஇயற் பால பல.
translation: Give up all to gain the True  And endless joys shall hence seek you
transliteration:
Ventin Un Taakath Thurakka
Thurandhapin Eentuiyar Paala Pala
explanation: After a man has renounced (all things), there will still be many things in this world (which he may enjoy); if he should desire them, let him, while it is time abandon (the world)

text:
அடல்வேண்டும் ஐந்தன் புலத்தை விடல்வேண்டும்
வேண்டிய வெல்லாம் ஒருங்கு.
translation: Curb the senses five and renounce  The carving desires all at once
transliteration:
Atalventum Aindhan Pulaththai Vitalventum
Ventiya Vellaam Orungu
explanation: Let the five senses be destroyed; and at the same time, let everything be abandoned that (the ascetic) has (formerly) desired

text:
இயல்பாகும் நோன்பிற்கொன்று இன்மை உடைமை
மயலாகும் மற்றும் பெயர்த்து.
translation: To have nothing is law of vows  Having the least deludes and snares
transliteration:
Iyalpaakum Nonpirkondru Inmai Utaimai
Mayalaakum Matrum Peyarththu
explanation: To be altogether destitute is the proper condition of those who perform austerities; if they possess anything, it will change (their resolution) and bring them back to their confused state

text:
மற்றும் தொடர்ப்பாடு எவன்கொல் பிறப்பறுக்கல்
உற்றார்க்கு உடம்பும் மிகை.
translation: Why add to bonds while this body  Is too much for saints to be birth-free
transliteration:
Matrum Thotarppaatu Evankol Pirapparukkal
Utraarkku Utampum Mikai
explanation: What means the addition of other things those who are attempting to cut off (future) births, when even their body is too much (for them)

text:
யான் எனது என்னும் செருக்கு அறுப்பான் வானோர்க்கு
உயர்ந்த உலகம் புகும்.
translation: Who curbs the pride of I and mine  Gets a world rare for gods to gain
transliteration:
Yaan Enadhu Ennum Serukku
Aruppaan Vaanorkku Uyarndha Ulakam
explanation: Shall enter realms above the powers divine

text:
பற்றி விடாஅ இடும்பைகள் பற்றினைப்
பற்றி விடாஅ தவர் க்கு.
translation: Grief clings on and on to those  Who cling to bonds without release
transliteration:
Patri Vitaaa Itumpaikal Patrinaip
Patri Vitaaa Thavarkku
explanation: Sorrows will never let go their hold of those who give not up their hold of desire

text:
தலைப்பட்டார் தீரத் துறந்தார் மயங்கி
வலைப்பட்டார் மற்றை யவர்.
translation: Who renounce all are free from care  Others suffer delusive snare
transliteration:
Thalaippattaar Theerath Thurandhaar Mayangi
Valaippattaar Matrai Yavar
explanation: Those who have entirely renounced (all things and all desire) have obtained (absorption into God); all others wander in confusion, entangled in the net of (many) births

text:
பற்றற்ற கண்ணே பிறப்பறுக்கும் மற்று
நிலையாமை காணப் படும்.
translation: Bondage cut off, rebirth is off  The world then seems instable stuff
transliteration:
Patratra Kanne Pirapparukkum Matru
Nilaiyaamai Kaanap Patum
explanation: At the moment in which desire has been abandoned, (other) births will be cut off; when that has not been done, instability will be seen

text:
பற்றுக பற்றற்றான் பற்றினை அப்பற்றைப்
பற்றுக பற்று விடற்கு.
translation: Bind Thyself to the unbound one  That binding breaks all bonds anon
transliteration:
Patruka Patratraan Patrinai Appatraip
Patruka Patru Vitarku
explanation: Desire the desire of Him who is without desire; in order to renounce desire, desire that desire

text:
பொருளல்ல வற்றைப் பொருளென்று உணரும்
மருளானாம் மாணாப் பிறப்பு.
translation: That error entails ignoble birth  Which deems vain things as things of worth
transliteration:
Porulalla Vatraip Porulendru Unarum
Marulaanaam Maanaap Pirappu
explanation: Inglorious births are produced by the confusion (of mind) which considers those things to be real which are not real

text:
இருள்நீங்கி இன்பம் பயக்கும் மருள்நீங்கி
மாசறு காட்சி யவர்க்கு.
translation: Men of spotless pure insight  Enjoy delight devoid of night
transliteration:
Irulneengi Inpam Payakkum Marulneengi
Maasaru Kaatchi Yavarkku
explanation: A clear, undimmed vision of things will deliver its possessors from the darkness of future births, and confer the felicity (of heaven)

text:
ஐயத்தின் நீங்கித் தெளிந்தார்க்கு வையத்தின்
வானம் நணிய துடைத்து.
translation: To doubtless minds whose heart is clear  More than earth heaven is near
transliteration:
Aiyaththin Neengith Thelindhaarkku Vaiyaththin
Vaanam Naniya Thutaiththu
explanation: Heaven is nearer than earth to those men of purified minds who are freed from from doubt

text:
ஐயுணர்வு எய்தியக் கண்ணும் பயமின்றே
மெய்யுணர்வு இல்லா தவர்க்கு.
translation: Knowledge of five senses is vain  Without knowing the Truth within
transliteration:
Aiyunarvu Eydhiyak Kannum Payamindre
Meyyunarvu Illaa Thavarkku
explanation: Even those who have all the knowledge which can be attained by the five senses, will derive no benefit from it, if they are without a knowledge of the true nature of things

text:
எப்பொருள் எத்தன்மைத் தாயினும் அப்பொருள்
மெய்ப்பொருள் காண்பது அறிவு.
translation: Knowledge is truth of things to find  In every case of every kind
transliteration:
Epporul Eththanmaith Thaayinum Apporul
Meypporul Kaanpadhu Arivu
explanation: (True) knowledge is the perception concerning every thing of whatever kind, that that thing is the true thing

text:
கற்றீண்டு மெய்ப்பொருள் கண்டார் தலைப்படுவர்
மற்றீண்டு வாரா நெறி.
translation: Who learn and here the Truth discern  Enter the path of non-return
transliteration:
Katreentu Meypporul Kantaar Thalaippatuvar
Matreentu Vaaraa Neri
explanation: They, who in this birth have learned to know the True Being, enter the road which returns not into this world

text:
ஓர்த்துள்ளம் உள்ளது உணரின் ஒருதலையாப்
பேர்த்துள்ள வேண்டா பிறப்பு.
translation: One-minded sage sees inner-truth  He is free from thoughts of rebirth
transliteration:
Orththullam Ulladhu Unarin Orudhalaiyaap
Perththulla Ventaa Pirappu
explanation: Let it not be thought that there is another birth for him whose mind having thoroughly considered (all it has been taught) has known the True Being

text:
பிறப்பென்னும் பேதைமை நீங்கச் சிறப்பென்னும்
செம்பொருள் காண்பது அறிவு.
translation: It is knowledge to know Self-Truth  And remove the folly of birth
transliteration:
Pirappennum Pedhaimai Neengach Chirappennum
Semporul Kaanpadhu Arivu
explanation: True knowledge consists in the removal of ignorance; which is (the cause of) births, and the perception of the True Being who is (the bestower of) heaven

text:
சார்புணர்ந்து சார்பு கெடஒழுகின் மற்றழித்துச்
சார்தரா சார்தரு நோய்.
translation: Know the Refuge; off with bondage  Be free from ills of thraldom, O sage
transliteration:
Saarpunarndhu Saarpu Ketaozhukin Matrazhiththuch
Chaardharaa Saardharu Noi
explanation: He who so lives as to know Him who is the support of all things and abandon all desire, will be freed from the evils which would otherwise cleave to him and destroy (his efforts after absorption)

text:
காமம் வெகுளி மயக்கம் இவ்முன்றன்
நாமம் கெடக்கெடும் நோய்.
translation: Woes expire when lust, wrath, folly  Expire even to name, fully
transliteration:
Kaamam Vekuli Mayakkam Ivaimundran
Naamam Ketakketum Noi
explanation: If the very names of these three things, desire, anger, and confusion of mind, be destroyed, then will also perish evils (which flow from them)

text:
அவாஎன்ப எல்லா உயிர்க்கும் எஞ் ஞான்றும்
தவாஅப் பிறப்பீனும் வித்து.
translation: Desire to all, always is seed  From which ceaseless births proceed
transliteration:
Avaaenpa Ellaa Uyirkkum Enj
Gnaandrum Thavaaap Pirappeenum Viththu
explanation: (The wise) say that the seed, which produces unceasing births, at all times, to all creatures, is desire

text:
வேண்டுங்கால் வேண்டும் பிறவாமை மற்றது
வேண்டாமை வேண்ட வரும்.
translation: If long thou must, long for non-birth  It comes by longing no more for earth
transliteration:
Ventungaal Ventum Piravaamai Matradhu
Ventaamai Venta Varum
explanation: If anything be desired, freedom from births should be desired; that (freedom from births) will be attained by desiring to be without desire

text:
வேண்டாமை அன்ன விழுச்செல்வம் ஈண்டில்லை
ஆண்டும் அஃதொப்பது இல்.
translation: No such wealth is here and there  As peerless wealth of non-desire
transliteration:
Ventaamai Anna Vizhuchchelvam Eentillai
Aantum Aqdhoppadhu Il
explanation: There is in this world no excellence equal to freedom from desire; and even in that world, there is nothing like it

text:
தூஉய்மை என்பது அவாவின்மை மற்றது
வாஅய்மை வேண்ட வரும்.
translation: To nothing crave is purity  That is the fruit of verity
transliteration:
Thoouymai Enpadhu Avaavinmai Matradhu
Vaaaimai Venta Varum
explanation: Purity (of mind) consists in freedom from desire; and that (freedom from desire) is the fruit of the love of truth

text:
அற்றவர் என்பார் அவாஅற்றார் மற்றையார்
அற்றாக அற்றது இலர்.
translation: The free are those who desire not  The rest not free in bonds are caught
transliteration:
Atravar Enpaar Avaaatraar Matraiyaar
Atraaka Atradhu Ilar
explanation: They are said to be free (from future birth) who are freed from desire; all others (who, whatever else they may be free from, are not freed from desire) are not thus free

text:
அஞ்சுவ தோரும் அறனே ஒருவனை
வஞ்சிப்ப தோரும் அவா.
translation: Dread desire; Virtue is there  To every soul desire is snare!
transliteration:
Anjuva Thorum Arane Oruvanai
Vanjippa Thorum Avaa
explanation: It is the chief duty of (an ascetic) to watch against desire with (jealous) fear; for it has power to deceive (and destroy) him

text:
அவாவினை ஆற்ற அறுப்பின் தவாவினை
தான்வேண்டு மாற்றான் வரும்.
translation: Destroy desire; deliverance  Comes as much as you aspire hence
transliteration:
Avaavinai Aatra Aruppin Thavaavinai
Thaanventu Maatraan Varum
explanation: If a man thoroughly cut off all desire, the deeds, which confer immortality, will come to him, in the path in which he seeks them

text:
அவாஇல்லார்க் கில்லாகுந் துன்பம் அஃதுண்டேல்
தவாஅது மேன்மேல் வரும்.
translation: Desire extinct no sorrow-taints  Grief comes on grief where it pretends
transliteration:
Avaaillaark Killaakun Thunpam Aqdhuntel
Thavaaadhu Menmel Varum
explanation: There is no sorrow to those who are without desire; but where that is, (sorrow) will incessantly come, more and more

text:
இன்பம் இடையறா தீண்டும் அவாவென்னும்
துன்பத்துள் துன்பங் கெடின்.
translation: Desire, the woe of woes destroy  Joy of joys here you enjoy
transliteration:
Inpam Itaiyaraa Theentum Avaavennum
Thunpaththul Thunpang Ketin
explanation: Even while in this body, joy will never depart (from the mind, in which) desire, that sorrow of sorrows, has been destroyed

text:
ஆரா இயற்கை அவாநீப்பின் அந்நிலையே
பேரா இயற்கை தரும்.
translation: Off with desire insatiate  You gain the native blissful state
transliteration:
Aaraa Iyarkai Avaaneeppin Annilaiye
Peraa Iyarkai Tharum
explanation: The removal of desire, whose nature it is never to be satisfied, will immediately confer a nature that can never be changed

text:
ஆகூழால் தோன்றும் அசைவின்மை கைப்பொருள்
போகூழால் தோன்றும் மடி.
translation: Efforts succeed by waxing star  Wealth-losing brings waning star
transliteration:
Aakoozhaal Thondrum Asaivinmai Kaipporul
Pokoozhaal Thondrum Mati
explanation: Perseverance comes from a prosperous fate, and idleness from an adverse fate

text:
பேதைப் படுக்கும் இழவூழ் அறிவகற்றும்
ஆகலூழ் உற்றக் கடை.
translation: Loss-fate makes a dull fool of us  Gain-fate makes us prosperous, wise!
transliteration:
Pedhaip Patukkum Izhavoozh Arivakatrum
Aakaloozh Utrak Katai
explanation: An adverse fate produces folly, and a prosperous fate produces enlarged knowledge

text:
நுண்ணிய நூல்பல கற்பினும் மற்றுந்தன்
உண்மை யறிவே மிகும்.
translation: What matters subtle study deep?  Levels of innate wisdom-keep
transliteration:
Nunniya Noolpala Karpinum Matrundhan
Unmai Yarive Mikum
explanation: Although (a man) may study the most polished treatises, the knowledge which fate has decreed to him will still prevail

text:
இருவேறு உலகத்து இயற்கை திருவேறு
தெள்ளிய ராதலும் வேறு.
translation: Two natures in the world obtain  Some wealth and others wisdom gain
transliteration:
Iruveru Ulakaththu Iyarkai Thiruveru
Thelliya Raadhalum Veru
explanation: There are (through fate) two different natures in the world, hence the difference (observable in men) in (their acquisition of) wealth, and in their attainment of knowledge

text:
நல்லவை எல்லாஅந் தீயவாம் தீயவும்
நல்லவாம் செல்வம் செயற்கு.
translation: In making wealth fate changes mood;  The good as bad and bad as good
transliteration:
Nallavai Ellaaan Theeyavaam Theeyavum
Nallavaam Selvam Seyarku
explanation: In the acquisition of property, every thing favourable becomes unfavourable, and (on the other hand) everything unfavourable becomes favourable, (through the power of fate)

text:
பரியினும் ஆகாவாம் பாலல்ல உய்த்துச்
சொரியினும் போகா தம.
translation: Things not thine never remain  Things destined are surely thine
transliteration:
Pariyinum Aakaavaam Paalalla Uyththuch
Choriyinum Pokaa Thama
explanation: Whatever is not conferred by fate cannot be preserved although it be guarded with most painful care; and that, which fate has made his, cannot be lost, although one should even take it and throw it away

text:
வகுத்தான் வகுத்த வகையல்லால் கோடி
தொகுத்தார்க்கு துய்த்தல் அரிது.
translation: Who crores amass enjoy but what  The Dispenser's decrees allot
transliteration:
Vakuththaan Vakuththa Vakaiyallaal Koti
Thokuththaarkku Thuyththal Aridhu
explanation: Even those who gather together millions will only enjoy them, as it has been determined by the disposer (of all things)

text:
துறப்பார்மன் துப்புர வில்லார் உறற்பால
ஊட்டா கழியு மெனின்.
translation: The destitute desire will quit  If fate with ills visit them not
transliteration:
Thurappaarman Thuppura Villaar Urarpaala
Oottaa Kazhiyu Menin
explanation: The destitute will renounce desire (and become ascetics), if (fate) do not make them suffer the hindrances to which they are liable, and they pass away

text:
நன்றாங்கால் நல்லவாக் காண்பவர் அன்றாங்கால்
அல்லற் படுவ தெவன்?
translation: Who good in time of good perceive  In evil time why should they grieve?
transliteration:
Nandraangaal Nallavaak Kaanpavar Andraangaal
Allar Patuva Thevan?
explanation: How is it that those, who are pleased with good fortune, trouble themselves when evil comes, (since both are equally the decree of fate) ?

text:
ஊழிற் பெருவலி யாவுள மற்றொன்று
சூழினுந் தான்முந் துறும்.
translation: What power surpasses fate? Its will  Persists against the human skill
transliteration:
Oozhir Peruvali Yaavula Matrondru
Soozhinun Thaanmun Thurum
explanation: What is stronger than fate ? If we think of an expedient (to avert it), it will itself be with us before (the thought)

text:
படைகுடி கூழ்அமைச்சு நட்பரண் ஆறும்
உடையான் அரசருள் ஏறு.
translation: People, troops, wealth, forts, council, friends  Who owns these six is lion of kings
transliteration:
Pataikuti Koozhamaichchu Natparan Aarum
Utaiyaan Arasarul Eru
explanation: He who possesses these six things, an army, a people, wealth, ministers, friends and a fortress, is a lion among kings

text:
அஞ்சாமை ஈகை அறிவூக்கம் இந்நான்கும்
எஞ்சாமை வேந்தர்க் கியல்பு.
translation: Courage, giving, knowledge and zeal  Are four failless features royal
transliteration:
Anjaamai Eekai Arivookkam Innaankum
Enjaamai Vendhark Kiyalpu
explanation: Never to fail in these four things, fearlessness, liberality, wisdom, and energy, is the kingly character

text:
தூங்காமை கல்வி துணிவுடைமை இம்மூன்றும்
நீங்கா நிலனான் பவர்க்கு.
translation: Alertness, learning bravery  Are adjuncts three of monarchy
transliteration:
Thoongaamai Kalvi Thunivutaimai Immoondrum
Neengaa Nilanaan Pavarkku
explanation: These three things, viz, vigilance, learning, and bravery, should never be wanting in the ruler of a country

text:
அறனிழுக்கா தல்லவை நீக்கி மறனிழுக்கா
மானம் உடைய தரசு.
translation: A brave noble king refrains from vice  Full of virtue and enterprise
transliteration:
Aranizhukkaa Thallavai Neekki Maranizhukkaa
Maanam Utaiya Tharasu
explanation: He is a king who, with manly modesty, swerves not from virtue, and refrains from vice

text:
இயற்றலும் ஈட்டலுங் காத்தலும் காத்த
வகுத்தலும் வல்ல தரசு.
translation: The able king gets, stores and guards  And spends them for people's safeguards
transliteration:
Iyatralum Eettalung Kaaththalum Kaaththa
Vakuththalum Valla Tharasu
explanation: He is a king who is able to acquire (wealth), to lay it up, to guard, and to distribute it

text:
காட்சிக் கெளியன் கடுஞ்சொல்லன் அல்லனேல்
மீக்கூறும் மன்னன் நிலம்
translation: That land prospers where the king is  Easy to see, not harsh of words
transliteration:
Kaatchik Keliyan Katunjollan Allanel
Meekkoorum Mannan Nilam
explanation: The whole world will exalt the country of the king who is easy of access, and who is free from harsh language

text:
இன்சொலால் ஈத்தளிக்க வல்லார்க்குத் தன்சொலால்
தான்கண் டனைத்திவ் வுலகு.
translation: The world commends and acts his phrase  Who sweetly speaks and gives with grace
transliteration:
Insolaal Eeththalikka Vallaarkkuth Thansolaal
Thaankan Tanaiththiv Vulaku
explanation: The world will praise and submit itself to the mind of the king who is able to give with affability, and to protect all who come to him

text:
முறைசெய்து காப்பாற்றும் மன்னவன் மக்கட்கு
இறையென்று வைக்கப் படும்.
translation: He is the Lord of men who does  Sound justice and saves his race
transliteration:
Muraiseydhu Kaappaatrum Mannavan Makkatku
Iraiyendru Vaikkap Patum
explanation: That king, will be esteemed a God among men, who performs his own duties, and protects (his subjects).

text:
செவிகைப்பச் சொற்பொறுக்கும் பண்புடை வேந்தன்
கவிகைக்கீழ்த் தங்கும் உலகு.
translation: Under his shelter thrives the world  Who bears remarks bitter and bold
transliteration:
Sevikaippach Chorporukkum Panputai Vendhan
Kavikaikkeezhth Thangum Ulaku
explanation: The whole world will dwell under the umbrella of the king, who can bear words that embitter the ear

text:
கொடையளி செங்கோல் குடியோம்பல் நான்கும்
உடையானாம் வேந்தர்க் கொளி.
translation: He is the Light of Kings who has  Bounty, justice, care and grace
transliteration:
Kotaiyali Sengol Kutiyompal Naankum
Utaiyaanaam Vendhark Koli
explanation: He is the light of kings who has there four things, beneficence, benevolence, rectitude, and care for his people

text:
கற்க கசடறக் கற்பவை கற்றபின்
நிற்க அதற்குத் தக.
translation: Lore worth learning, learn flawlessly  Live by that learning thoroughly
transliteration:
Karka Kasatarak Karpavai Katrapin
Nirka Adharkuth Thaka
explanation: Let a man learn thoroughly whatever he may learn, and let his conduct be worthy of his learning

text:
எண்ணென்ப ஏனை எழுத்தென்ப இவ்விரண் டும்
கண்ணென்ப வாழும் உயிர்க்கு.
translation: Letter, number, art and science  Of living kind both are the eyes
transliteration:
Ennenpa Enai Ezhuththenpa Ivvirantum
Kannenpa Vaazhum Uyirkku
explanation: Letters and numbers are the two eyes of man

text:
கண்ணுடையர் என்பவர் கற்றோர் முகத்திரண்டு
புண்ணுடையர் கல்லா தவர்.
translation: The learned alone have eyes on face  The ignorant two sores of disgrace
transliteration:
Kannutaiyar Enpavar Katror Mukaththirantu
Punnutaiyar Kallaa Thavar
explanation: The learned are said to have eyes, but the unlearned have (merely) two sores in their face

text:
உவப்பத் தலைக்கூடி உள்ளப் பிரிதல்
அனைத்தே புலவர் தொழில்.
translation: To meet with joy and part with thought  Of learned men this is the art
transliteration:
Uvappath Thalaikkooti Ullap Piridhal
Anaiththe Pulavar Thozhil
explanation: It is the part of the learned to give joy to those whom they meet, and on leaving, to make them think (Oh! when shall we meet them again.)

text:
உடையார்முன் இல்லார்போல் ஏக்கற்றுங் கற்றார்
கடையரே கல்லா தவர்.
translation: Like poor before rich they yearn:  For knowledge: the low never learn
transliteration:
Utaiyaarmun Illaarpol Ekkatrung Katraar
Kataiyare Kallaa Thavar
explanation: The unlearned are inferior to the learned, before whom they stand begging, as the destitute before the wealthy

text:
தொட்டனைத் தூறும் மணற்கேணி மாந்தர்க்குக்
கற்றனைத் தூறும் அறிவு.
translation: As deep you dig the sand spring flows  As deep you learn the knowledge grows
transliteration:
Thottanaith Thoorum Manarkeni Maandharkkuk
Katranaith Thoorum Arivu
explanation: Water will flow from a well in the sand in proportion to the depth to which it is dug, and knowledge will flow from a man in proportion to his learning

text:
யாதானும் நாடாமால் ஊராமால் என்னொருவன்
சாந்துணையுங் கல்லாத வாறு.
translation: All lands and towns are learner's own  Why not till death learning go on!
transliteration:
Yaadhaanum Naataamaal Ooraamaal Ennoruvan
Saandhunaiyung Kallaadha Vaaru
explanation: How is it that any one can remain without learning, even to his death, when (to the learned man) every country is his own (country), and every town his own (town) ?

text:
ஒருமைக்கண் தான் கற்ற கல்வி ஒருவற்கு
எழுமையும் ஏமாப் புடைத்து.
translation: The joy of learning in one birth  Exalts man upto his seventh
transliteration:
Orumaikkan Thaan Katra Kalvi
Oruvarku Ezhumaiyum Emaap Putaiththu
explanation: The learning, which a man has acquired in one birth, will yield him pleasure during seven births

text:
தாமின் புறுவது உலகின் புறக் கண்டு
காமுறுவர் கற்றறிந் தார்.
translation: The learned foster learning more  On seeing the world enjoy their lore
transliteration:
Thaamin Puruvadhu Ulakin Purak
Kantu Kaamuruvar Katrarin Thaar
explanation: The learned will long (for more learning), when they see that while it gives pleasure to themselves, the world also derives pleasure from it

text:
கேடில் விழுச்செல்வம் கல்வி யொருவற்கு
மாடல்ல மற்றை யவை.
translation: Learning is wealth none could destroy  Nothing else gives genuine joy
transliteration:
Ketil Vizhuchchelvam Kalvi Yoruvarku
Maatalla Matrai Yavai
explanation: Learning is the true imperishable riches; all other things are not riches

text:
அரங்கின்றி வட்டாடி யற்றே நிரம்பிய
நூலின்றிக் கோட்டி கொளல்.
translation: Like play of chess on squareless board  Vain is imperfect loreless word
transliteration:
Arangindri Vattaati Yatre Nirampiya
Noolindrik Kotti Kolal
explanation: To speak in an assembly (of the learned) without fullness of knowledge, is like playing at chess (on a board) without squares

text:
கல்லாதான் சொற்கா முறுதல் முலையிரண்டும்
இல்லாதாள் பெண்காமுற் றற்று.
translation: Unlearned man aspiring speech  Is breastless lady's love-approach
transliteration:
Kallaadhaan Sorkaa Murudhal Mulaiyirantum
Illaadhaal Penkaamur Ratru
explanation: The desire of the unlearned to speak (in an assembly), is like a woman without breasts desiring (the enjoyment of ) woman-hood

text:
கல்லா தவரும் நனிநல்லர் கற்றார்முன்
சொல்லா திருக்கப் பெறின்.
translation: Ev'n unread men are good and wise  If before the wise, they hold their peace
transliteration:
Kallaa Thavarum Naninallar Katraarmun
Sollaa Thirukkap Perin
explanation: The unlearned also are very excellent men, if they know how to keep silence before the learned

text:
கல்லாதான் ஒட்பம் கழியநன் றாயினும்
கொள்ளார் அறிவுடை யார்.
translation: The unread's wit though excellent  Is not valued by the savant
transliteration:
Kallaadhaan Otpam Kazhiyanan Raayinum
Kollaar Arivutai Yaar
explanation: Although the natural knowledge of an unlearned man may be very good, the wise will not accept for true knowledge

text:
கல்லா ஒருவன் தகைமை தலைப்பெய்து
சொல்லாடச் சோர்வு படும்.
translation: A man untaught when speech he vaunts  Sadly fails before savants
transliteration:
Kallaa Oruvan Thakaimai Thalaippeydhu
Sollaatach Chorvu Patum
explanation: The self-conceit of an unlearned man will fade away, as soon as he speaks in an assembly (of

text:
உளரென்னும் மாத்திரையர் அல்லால் பயவாக்
களரனையர் கல்லா தவர்.
translation: People speak of untaught minds  \"They just exist like barren lands\"
transliteration:
Ularennum Maaththiraiyar Allaal Payavaak
Kalaranaiyar Kallaa Thavar
explanation: The unlearned are like worthless barren land: all that can be said of them is, that they exist

text:
நுண்மாண் நுழைபுலம் இல்லான் எழில்நலம்
மண்மாண் புனைபாவை யற்று.
translation: Like painted clay-doll is his show  Grand subtle lore who fails to know
transliteration:
Nunmaan Nuzhaipulam Illaan Ezhilnalam
Manmaan Punaipaavai Yatru
explanation: The beauty and goodness of one who is destitute of knowledge by the study of great and exquisite works, is like (the beauty and goodness) of a painted earthen doll

text:
நல்லார்கண் பட்ட வறுமையின் இன்னாதே
கல்லார்கண் பட் ட திரு.
translation: Wealth in the hand of fools is worse  Than a learned man's empty purse
transliteration:
Nallaarkan Patta Varumaiyin Innaadhe
Kallaarkan Patta Thiru
explanation: Wealth, gained by the unlearned, will give more sorrow than the poverty which may come upon the learned

text:
மேற்பிறந்தா ராயினும் கல்லாதார் கீழ்ப்பிறந்தும்
கற்றார் அனைத்திலர் பாடு.
translation: Lower are fools of higher birth  Than low-born men of learning's worth
transliteration:
Merpirandhaa Raayinum Kallaadhaar Keezhppirandhum
Katraar Anaiththilar Paatu
explanation: The unlearned, though born in a high caste, are not equal in dignity to the learned; though they may have been born in a low caste

text:
விலங்கொடு மக்கள் அனையர் இலங்குநூல்
கற்றாரோடு ஏனை யவர்.
translation: Like beasts before men, dunces are  Before scholars of shining lore
transliteration:
Vilangotu Makkal Anaiyar Ilangunool
Katraarotu Enai Yavar
explanation: As beasts by the side of men, so are other men by the side of those who are learned in celebrated works

text:
செல்வத்துட் செல்வஞ் செவிச்செல்வம் அச்செல்வம்
செல்வத்து ளெல்லாந் தலை.
translation: Wealth of wealths is listening's wealth  It is the best of wealths on earth
transliteration:
Selvaththut Selvanj Chevichchelvam Achchelvam
Selvaththu Lellaan Thalai
explanation: Wealth (gained) by the ear is wealth of wealth; that wealth is the chief of all wealth

text:
செவுக்குண வில்லாத போழ்து சிறிது
வயிற்றுக்கும் ஈயப் படும்.
translation: Some food for the stomach is brought  When the ear gets no food for thought
transliteration:
Sevikkuna Villaadha Pozhdhu Siridhu
Vayitrukkum Eeyap Patum
explanation: When there is no food for the ear, give a little also to the stomach

text:
செவியுணவிற் கேள்வி யுடையார் அவியுணவின்
ஆன்றாரோ டொப்பர் நிலத்து.
translation: Whose ears get lots of wisdom-food  Equal gods on oblations fed
transliteration:
Seviyunavir Kelvi Yutaiyaar Aviyunavin
Aandraaro Toppar Nilaththu
explanation: Those who in this world enjoy instruction which is the food of the ear, are equal to the Gods, who enjoy the food of the sacrifices

text:
கற்றில னாயினுங் கேட்க அஃதொருவற்கு
ஒற்கத்தின் ஊற்றாந் துணை.
translation: Though not learned, hear and heed  That serves a staff and stay in need
transliteration:
Katrila Naayinung Ketka Aqdhoruvarku
Orkaththin Ootraan Thunai
explanation: Although a man be without learning, let him listen (to the teaching of the learned); that will be to him a staff in adversity

text:
இழுக்கல் உடையுழி ஊற்றுக்கோல் அற்றே
ஒழுக்க முடையார்வாய்ச் சொல்.
translation: Virtuous men's wisdom is found  A strong staff on slippery ground
transliteration:
Izhukkal Utaiyuzhi Ootrukkol Atre
Ozhukka Mutaiyaarvaaich Chol
explanation: The words of the good are like a staff in a slippery place

text:
எனைத்தானும் நல்லவை கேட்க அனைத்தானும்
ஆன்ற பெருமை தரும்.
translation: Lend ear to good words however few  That much will highly exalt you
transliteration:
Enaiththaanum Nallavai Ketka Anaiththaanum
Aandra Perumai Tharum
explanation: Let a man listen, never so little, to good (instruction), even that will bring him great dignity

text:
பிழைத் துணர்ந்தும் பேதைமை சொல்லா ரிழைத்துணர்ந்
தீண்டிய கேள்வி யவர்.
translation: Who listen well and learn sharply  Not ev'n by slip speak foolishly
transliteration:
Pizhaith Thunarndhum Pedhaimai Sollaa
Rizhaiththunarn Theentiya Kelvi Yavar
explanation: Not even when they have imperfectly understood (a matter), will those men speak foolishly, who have profoundly studied and diligently listened (to instruction)

text:
கேட்பினுங் கேளாத் தகையவே கேள்வியால்
தோட்கப் படாத செவி.
translation: That ear though hearing is dulled  Which is not by wisdom drilled
transliteration:
Ketpinung Kelaath Thakaiyave Kelviyaal
Thotkap Pataadha Sevi
explanation: The ear which has not been bored by instruction, although it hears, is deaf

text:
நுணங்கிய கேள்விய ரல்லார் வணங்கிய
வாயின ராதல் அரிது.
translation: A modest mouth is hard for those  Who care little to counsels wise
transliteration:
Nunangiya Kelviya Rallaar Vanangiya
Vaayina Raadhal Aridhu
explanation: It is a rare thing to find modesty, a reverend mouth- with those who have not received choice instruction

text:
செவியிற் சுவையுணரா வாயுணர்வின் மாக்கள்
அவியினும் வாழினும் என்?
translation: Who taste by mouth and not by ear  What if they fare ill or well here?
transliteration:
Seviyir Suvaiyunaraa Vaayunarvin Maakkal
Aviyinum Vaazhinum En?
explanation: What does it matter whether those men live or die, who can judge of tastes by the mouth, and not by the ear ?

text:
அறிவற்றங் காக்குங் கருவி செறுவார்க்கும்
உள்ளழிக்க லாகா அரண்.
translation: Wisdom's weapon wards off all woes  It is a fort defying foes
transliteration:
Arivatrang Kaakkung Karuvi Seruvaarkkum
Ullazhikka Laakaa Aran
explanation: Wisdom is a weapon to ward off destruction; it is an inner fortress which enemies cannot destroy

text:
சென்ற இடத்தால் செலவிடா தீதொரீஇ
நன்றின்பால் உய்ப்ப தறிவு.
translation: Wisdom checks the straying senses  Expels evils, impels goodness
transliteration:
Sendra Itaththaal Selavitaa Theedhoreei
Nandrinpaal Uyppa Tharivu
explanation: Not to permit the mind to go where it lists, to keep it from evil, and to employ it in good, this is wisdom

text:
எப்பொருள் யார்யார்வாய்க் கேட்பினும் அப்பொருள்
மெய்ப்பொருள் காண்ப தறிவு.
translation: To grasp the Truth from everywhere  From everyone is wisdom fair
transliteration:
Epporul Yaaryaarvaaik Ketpinum Apporul
Meypporul Kaanpa Tharivu
explanation: To discern the truth in every thing, by whomsoever spoken, is wisdom

text:
எண்பொருள வாகச் செலச்சொல்லித் தான்பிறர்வாய்
நுண்பொருள் காண்ப தறிவு.
translation: Speaking out thoughts in clear trends  Wisdom subtle sense comprehends
transliteration:
Enporula Vaakach Chelachchollith Thaanpirarvaai
Nunporul Kaanpa Tharivu
explanation: To speak so as that the meaning may easily enter the mind of the hearer, and to discern the subtlest thought which may lie hidden in the words of others, this is wisdom

text:
உலகம் தழீஇய தொட்பம் மலர்தலும்
கூம்பலும் இல்ல தறிவு.
translation: The wise-world the wise befriend  They bloom nor gloom, equal in mind
transliteration:
Ulakam Thazheeiya Thotpam Malardhalum
Koompalum Illa Tharivu
explanation: To secure the friendship of the great is true wisdom; it is (also) wisdom to keep (that friendship unchanged, and) not opening and closing (like the lotus flower)

text:
எவ்வ துறைவது உலகம் உலகத்தோடு
அவ்வ துறைவ தறிவு.
translation: As moves the world so move the wise  In tune with changing times and ways
transliteration:
Evva Thuraivadhu Ulakam Ulakaththotu
Avva Thuraiva Tharivu
explanation: To live as the world lives, is wisdom

text:
அறிவுடையார் ஆவ தறிவார் அறிவிலார்
அஃதறி கல்லா தவர்.
translation: The wise foresee what is to come  The unwise lack in that wisdom
transliteration:
Arivutaiyaar Aava Tharivaar Arivilaar
Aqdhari Kallaa Thavar
explanation: The wise are those who know beforehand what will happen; those who do not know this are the unwise

text:
அஞ்சுவ தஞ்சாமை பேதைமை அஞ்சுவது
அஞ்சல் அறிவார் தொழில்.
translation: Fear the frightful and act wisely  Not to fear the frightful's folly
transliteration:
Anjuva Thanjaamai Pedhaimai Anjuvadhu
Anjal Arivaar Thozhil
explanation: Not to fear what ought to be feared, is folly; it is the work of the wise to fear what should be feared

text:
எதிரதாக் காக்கும் அறிவினார்க் கில்லை
அதிர வருவதோர் நோய்.
translation: No frightful evil shocks the wise  Who guard themselves against surprise
transliteration:
Edhiradhaak Kaakkum Arivinaark Killai
Adhira Varuvadhor Noi
explanation: No terrifying calamity will happen to the wise, who (foresee) and guard against coming evils

text:
அறிவுடையார் எல்லா முடையார் அறிவிலார்
என்னுடைய ரேனும் இலர்.
translation: Who have wisdom they are all full  Whatev'r they own, misfits are nil
transliteration:
Arivutaiyaar Ellaa Mutaiyaar Arivilaar
Ennutaiya Renum Ilar
explanation: Those who possess wisdom, possess every thing; those who have not wisdom, whatever they may possess, have nothing

text:
செருக்குஞ் சினமும் சிறுமையும் இல்லார்
பெருக்கம் பெருமித நீர்த்து.
translation: Plenty is their prosperity  Who're free from wrath pride lust petty
transliteration:
Serukkunj Chinamum Sirumaiyum Illaar
Perukkam Perumidha Neerththu
explanation: Truly great is the excellence of those (kings) who are free from pride, anger, and lust

text:
இவறலும் மாண்பிறந்த மானமும் மாணா
உவகையும் ஏதம் இறைக்கு.
translation: Mean pride, low pleasure, avarice  These add blemishes to a prince
transliteration:
Ivaralum Maanpirandha Maanamum Maanaa
Uvakaiyum Edham Iraikku
explanation: Avarice, undignified pride, and low pleasures are faults in a king

text:
தினைத்துணையாங் குற்றம் வரினும் பனைத்துணையாக்
கொள்வர் பழிநாணு வார்.
translation: Though millet-small their faults might seem  Men fearing disgrace, Palm-tall deem
transliteration:
Thinaiththunaiyaang Kutram Varinum Panaiththunaiyaak
Kolvar Pazhinaanu Vaar
explanation: Those who fear guilt, if they commit a fault small as a millet seed, will consider it to be as large as a palmyra tree

text:
குற்றமே காக்க பொருளாகக் குற்றமே
அற்றந் த்ரூஉம் பகை.
translation: Watch like treasure freedom from fault  Our fatal foe is that default
transliteration:
Kutrame Kaakka Porulaakak Kutrame
Atran Tharooum Pakai
explanation: Guard against faults as a matter (of great consequence; for) faults are a deadly enemy

text:
வருமுன்னர்க் காவாதான் வாழ்க்கை எரிமுன்னர்
வைத்தூறு போலக் கெடும்.
translation: Who fails to guard himself from flaw  Loses his life like flame-lit straw
transliteration:
Varumunnark Kaavaadhaan Vaazhkkai Erimunnar
Vaiththooru Polak Ketum
explanation: The prosperity of him who does not timely guard against faults, will perish like straw before fire

text:
தன்குற்றம் நீக்கிப் பிறர்குற்றங் காண்கிற்பின்
என்குற்ற மாகும் இறைக்கு?
translation: What fault can be the king's who cures  First his faults, then scans others
transliteration:
Thankutram Neekkip Pirarkutrang Kaankirpin
Enkutra Maakum Iraikku?
explanation: What fault will remain in the king who has put away his own evils, and looks after the evils of others

text:
செயற்பால செய்யா திவறியான் செல்வம்
உயற்பால தன்றிக் கெடும்.
translation: That miser's wealth shall waste and end  Who would not for a good cause spend
transliteration:
Seyarpaala Seyyaa Thivariyaan Selvam
Uyarpaala Thandrik Ketum
explanation: The wealth of the avaricious man, who does not expend it for the purposes for which he ought to expend it will waste away and not continue

text:
பற்றுள்ளம் என்னும் இவறன்மை எற்றுள்ளும்
எண்ணப் படுவதொன் றன்று.
translation: The gripping greed of miser's heart  Is more than fault the worst apart
transliteration:
Patrullam Ennum Ivaranmai Etrullum
Ennap Patuvadhon Randru
explanation: Griping avarice is not to be reckoned as one among other faults; (it stands alone - greater than all)

text:
வியவற்க எஞ்ஞான்றும் தன்னை நயவற்க
நன்றி பயவா வினை.
translation: Never boast yourself in any mood  Nor do a deed that does no good
transliteration:
Viyavarka Egngnaandrum Thannai Nayavarka
Nandri Payavaa Vinai
explanation: Let no (one) praise himself, at any time; let him not desire to do useless things

text:
காதல காதல் அறியாமை உய்க்கிற்பின்
ஏதில ஏதிலார் நூல்.
translation: All designs of the foes shall fail  If one his wishes guards in veil
transliteration:
Kaadhala Kaadhal Ariyaamai Uykkirpin
Edhila Edhilaar Nool
explanation: If (a king) enjoys, privately the things which he desires, the designs of his enemies will be useless

text:
அறனறிந்து மூத்த அறிவுடையார் கேண்மை
திறனறிந்து தேர்ந்து கொளல்.
translation: Weigh their worth and friendship gain  Of men of virtue and mature brain
transliteration:
Aranarindhu Mooththa Arivutaiyaar Kenmai
Thiranarindhu Therndhu Kolal
explanation: Let (a king) ponder well its value, and secure the friendship of men of virtue and of mature knowledge

text:
உற்றநோய் நீக்கி உறாஅமை முற்காக்கும்
பெற்றியார்ப் பேணிக் கொளல்.
translation: Cherish the help of men of skill  Who ward and safe-guard you from ill
transliteration:
Utranoi Neekki Uraaamai Murkaakkum
Petriyaarp Penik Kolal
explanation: Let (a king) procure and kindly care for men who can overcome difficulties when they occur, and guard against them before they happen

text:
அரியவற்று ளெல்லாம் அரிதே பெரியாரைப்
பேணித் தமராக் கொளல்.
translation: Honour and have the great your own  Is rarest of the rare things known
transliteration:
Ariyavatru Lellaam Aridhe Periyaaraip
Penith Thamaraak Kolal
explanation: To cherish great men and make them his own, is the most difficult of all difficult things

text:
தம்மிற் பெரியார் தமரா ஒழுகுதல்
வன்மையு ளெல்லாந் தலை.
translation: To have betters as intimates  Power of all powers promotes
transliteration:
Thammir Periyaar Thamaraa Ozhukudhal
Vanmaiyu Lellaan Thalai
