explanation: Not to perform a ruinous act, and not to be discouraged by the ruinous termination of an act, are the two maxims which, the wise say, from the principles of those who have investigated the subject

text:
கடைக்கொட்கச் செய்தக்க தாண்மை இடைக்கொட்கின்
எற்றா விழுமந் தரும்.
translation: The strong achieve and then display Woe unto work displayed midway
transliteration:
Kataikkotkach Cheydhakka Thaanmai Itaikkotkin
Etraa Vizhuman Tharum
explanation: So to perform an act as to publish it (only) at its termination is (true) manliness; for to announce it beforehand, will cause irremediable sorrow

text:
சொல்லுதல் யார்க்கும் எளிய அரியவாம்
சொல்லிய வண்ணம் செயல்.
translation: Easy it is to tell a fact But hard it is to know and act
transliteration:
Solludhal Yaarkkum Eliya Ariyavaam
Solliya Vannam Seyal
explanation: To say (how an act is to be performed) is (indeed) easy for any one; but far difficult it is to do according to what has been said

text:
வீறெய்தி மாண்டார் வினைத்திட்பம் வேந்தன்கண்
ஊறெய்தி உள்ளப் படும்.
translation: Dynamic deeds of a doughty soul Shall win the praise of king and all
transliteration:
Veereydhi Maantaar Vinaiththitpam Vendhankan
Ooreydhi Ullap Patum
explanation: The firmness in action of those who have become great by the excellence (of their counsel) will, by attaining its fulfilment in the person of the king, be esteemed (by all).

text:
எண்ணிய எண்ணியாங்கு எய்துவர் எண்ணியார்
திண்ணியர் ஆகப் பெறின்.
translation: The will-to-do achieves the deed When mind that wills is strong indeed
transliteration:
Enniya Enniyaangu Eydhu Enniyaar
Thinniyar Aakap Perin
explanation: If those who have planned (an undertaking) possess firmness (in executing it) they will obtain what they have desired even as they have desired it

text:
உருவுகண்டு எள்ளாமை வேண்டும் உருள்பெருந்தேர்க்கு
அச்சாணி அன்னார் உடைத்து.
translation: Scorn not the form: for men there are Like linchpin of big rolling car
transliteration:
Uruvukantu Ellaamai Ventum Urulperundherkku
Achchaani Annaar Utaiththu
explanation: Let none be despised for (their) size; (for) the world has those who resemble the linch-pin of the big rolling car

text:
கலங்காது கண்ட வினைக்கண் துளங்காது
தூக்கங் கடிந்து செயல்.
translation: Waver not; do wakefully  The deed resolved purposefully
transliteration:
Kalangaadhu Kanta Vinaikkan Thulangaadhu
Thookkang Katindhu Seyal
explanation: An act that has been firmly resolved on must be as firmly carried out without delay

text:
துன்பம் உறவரினும் செய்க துணிவாற்றி
இன்பம் பயக்கும் வினை.
translation: Do with firm will though pains beset  The deed that brings delight at last
transliteration:
Thunpam Uravarinum Seyka Thunivaatri
Inpam Payakkum Vinai
explanation: Though it should cause increasing sorrow (at the outset), do with firmness the act that yield bliss (in the end)

text:
எனைத்திட்பம் எய் தியக் கண்ணும் வினைத்திட்பம்
வேண்டாரை வேண்டாது உலகு.
translation: The world merits no other strength But strength of will-to-do at length
transliteration:
Enaiththitpam Ey Thiyak Kannum
Vinaiththitpam Ventaarai Ventaadhu Ulaku
explanation: The great will not esteem those who esteem not firmness of action, whatever other abilities the latter may possess

text:
சூழ்ச்சி முடிவு துணிவெய்தல் அத்துணிவு
தாழ்ச்சியுள் தங்குதல் தீது.
translation: When counsel takes a resolve strong Weak delay of action is wrong
transliteration:
Soozhchchi Mutivu Thuniveydhal Aththunivu
Thaazhchchiyul Thangudhal Theedhu
explanation: Consultation ends in forming a resolution (to act); (but) delay in the execution of that resolve is an evil

text:
தூங்குக தூங்கிச் செயற்பால தூங்கற்க
தூங்காது செய்யும் வினை.
translation: Delay such acts as need delay Delay not acts that need display
transliteration:
Thoonguka Thoongich Cheyarpaala Thoongarka
Thoongaadhu Seyyum Vinai
explanation: Sleep over such (actions) as may be slept over; (but) never over such as may not be slept over

text:
ஙல்லும்வா யெல்லாம் வினைநன்றே ஒல்லாக்கால்
செல்லும்வாய் நோக்கிச் செயல்.
translation: It's best to act when feasible If not see what is possible
transliteration:
Ollumvaa Yellaam Vinainandre Ollaakkaal
Sellumvaai Nokkich Cheyal
explanation: Whenever it is possible (to overcome your enemy) the act (of fighting) is certainly good; if not, endeavour to employ some more successful method

text:
வினைபகை என்றிரண்டின் எச்சம் நினையுங்கால்
தீயெச்சம் போலத் தெறும்.
translation: Work or foe left unfinished Flare up like fire unextinguished
transliteration:
Vinaipakai Endrirantin Echcham Ninaiyungaal
Theeyechcham Polath Therum
explanation: When duly considered, the incomplete execution of an undertaking and hostility will grow and destroy one like the (unextinguished) remnant of a fire

text:
பொருள்கருவி காலம் வினையிடனொடு ஐந்தும்
இருள்தீர எண்ணிச் செயல்.
translation: Money and means, time, place and deed Decide these five and then proceed
transliteration:
Porulkaruvi Kaalam Vinaiyitanotu Aindhum
Iruldheera Ennich Cheyal
explanation: Do an act after a due consideration of the (following) five, viz money, means, time, execution and place

text:
முடிவும் இடையூறும் முற்றியாங்கு எய்தும்
படுபயனும் பார்த்துச் செயல்.
translation: Weigh well the end, hindrance, profit  And then pursue a fitting act
transliteration:
Mutivum Itaiyoorum Mutriyaangu Eydhum
Patupayanum Paarththuch Cheyal
explanation: An act is to be performed after considering the exertion required, the obstacles to be encountered, and the great profit to be gained (on its completion)

text:
செய்வினை செய்வான் செயன்முறை அவ்வினை
உள்ளறிவான் உள்ளம் கொளல்.
translation: Know first the secret from experts That is the way of fruitful acts
transliteration:
Seyvinai Seyvaan Seyanmurai Avvinai
Ullarivaan Ullam Kolal
explanation: The method of performance for one who has begun an act is to ascertain the mind of him who knows the secret thereof

text:
வினையான் வினையாக்கிக் கோடல் நனைகவுள்
யானையால் யானையாத் தற்று.
translation: Lure a tusker by a tusker Achieve a deed by deed better
transliteration:
Vinaiyaan Vinaiyaakkik Kotal Nanaikavul
Yaanaiyaal Yaanaiyaath Thatru
explanation: To make one undertaking the means of accomplishing another (similar to it) is like making one rutting elephant the means of capturing another

text:
நட்டார்க்கு நல்ல செயலின் விரைந்ததே
ஒட்டாரை ஒட்டிக் கொளல்.
translation: Than doing good to friends it is More urgent to befriend the foes
transliteration:
Nattaarkku Nalla Seyalin Viraindhadhe
Ottaarai Ottik Kolal
explanation: One should rather hasten to secure the alliance of the foes (of one's foes) than perform good offices to one's friends

text:
உறைசிறியார் உள்நடுங்கல் அஞ்சிக் குறைபெறின்
கொள்வர் பெரியார்ப் பணிந்து.
translation: Small statesmen fearing people's fear Submit to foes superior
transliteration:
Uraisiriyaar Ulnatungal Anjik Kuraiperin
Kolvar Periyaarp Panindhu
explanation: Ministers of small states, afraid of their people being frightened, will yield to and acknowledge their superior foes, if the latter offer them a chance of reconciliation

text:
அன்புடைமை ஆன்ற குடிப்பிறத்தல் வேந்தவாம்
பண்புடைமை தூதுரைப்பான் பண்பு.
translation: Love, noble birth, good courtesy Pleasing kings mark true embassy
transliteration:
Anputaimai Aandra Kutippiraththal Vendhavaam
Panputaimai Thoodhuraippaan Panpu
explanation: The qualification of an ambassador are affection (for his relations) a fitting birth, and the possession of attributes pleasing to royalty

text:
அன்பறிவு ஆராய்ந்த சொல்வன்மை தூதுரைப்பார்க்கு
இன்றி யமையாத மூன்று.
translation: Envoys must bear love for their prince Knowledge and learned eloquence
transliteration:
Anparivu Aaraaindha Solvanmai Thoodhuraippaarkku
Indri Yamaiyaadha Moondru
explanation: Love (to his sovereign), knowledge (of his affairs), and a discriminating power of speech (before other sovereigns) are the three sine qua non qualifications of an ambassador

text:
நூலாருள் நூல்வல்லன் ஆகுதல் வேலாருள்
வென்றி வினையுரைப்பான் பண்பு.
translation: Savant among savants, he pleads  Before lanced king, triumphant words
transliteration:
Noolaarul Noolvallan Aakudhal Velaarul
Vendri Vinaiyuraippaan Panpu
explanation: To be powerful in politics among those who are learned (in ethics) is the character of him who speaks

text:
அறிவுரு வாராய்ந்த கல்விஇம் மூன்றன்
செறிவுடையான் செல்க வினைக்கு.
translation: Who has these three: good form, sense, lore Can act as bold ambassador
transliteration:
Arivuru Vaaraaindha Kalviim Moondran
Serivutaiyaan Selka Vinaikku
explanation: He may go on a mission (to foreign rulers) who has combined in him all these three viz, (natural) sense, an attractive bearing and well-tried learning

text:
தொகச் சொல்லித் தூவாத நீக்கி நகச்சொல்லி
நன்றி பயப்பதாந் தூது.
translation: Not harsh, the envoy's winsome ways Does good by pleasant words concise
transliteration:
Thokach Chollith Thoovaadha Neekki
Nakachcholli Nandri Payappadhaan Thoodhu
explanation: He is an ambassador who (in the presence of foreign rulers) speaks briefly, avoids harshness, talks so as to make them smile, and thus brings good (to his own sovereign)

text:
கற்றுக்கண் அஞ்சான் செலச்சொல்லிக் காலத்தால்
தக்கது அறிவதாம் தூது.
translation: Learned; fearless, the envoy tends Convincing words which time demands
transliteration:
Katrukkan Anjaan Selachchollik Kaalaththaal
Thakkadhu Arivadhaam Thoodhu
explanation: He is an ambassador who having studied (politics) talks impressively, is not afraid of angry looks, and knows (to employ) the art suited to the time

text:
கடனறிந்து காலங் கருதி இடனறிந்து
எண்ணி உரைப்பான் தலை.
translation: Knowing duty time and place The envoy employs mature phrase
transliteration:
Katanarindhu Kaalang Karudhi Itanarindhu
Enni Uraippaan Thalai
explanation: He is chief (among ambassadors) who understands the proper decorum (before foreign princes), seeks the (proper) occasion, knows the (most suitable) place, and delivers his message after (due)

text:
தூய்மை துணைமை துணிவுடைமை இம்மூன்றின்
வாய்மை வழியுரைப்பான் பண்பு.
translation: The true envoy of three virtues Is pure helpful and bold in views
transliteration:
Thooimai Thunaimai Thunivutaimai Immoondrin
Vaaimai Vazhiyuraippaan Panpu
explanation: The qualifications of him who faithfully delivers his (sovereign's) message are purity, the support (of foreign ministers), and boldness, with truthfulness in addition to the (aforesaid) three

text:
விடுமாற்றம் வேந்தர்க்கு உரைப்பான் வடுமாற்றம்
வாய்சேரா வன்கணவன்.
translation: The envoy who ports the king's message Has flawless words and heart's courage
transliteration:
Vitumaatram Vendharkku Uraippaan Vatumaatram
Vaaiseraa Vanka Navan
explanation: He alone is fit to communicate (his sovereign's) reply, who possesses the firmness not to utter even inadvertently what may reflect discredit (on the latter)

text:
இறுதி பயப்பினும் எஞ்சாது இறைவற் கு
உறுதி பயப்பதாம் தூது.
translation: Braving death the bold envoy Assures his king's safety and joy
transliteration:
Irudhi Payappinum Enjaadhu Iraivarku
Urudhi Payappadhaam Thoodhu
explanation: He is the ambassador who fearlessly seeks his sovereign's good though it should cost him his life (to deliver his message)

text:
அகலாது அணுகாது தீக்காய்வார் போல்க
இகல்வேந்தர்ச் சேர்ந்தொழுகு வார்.
translation: Move with hostile kings as with fire  Not coming close nor going far
transliteration:
Akalaadhu Anukaadhu Theekkaaivaar Polka
Ikalvendharch Cherndhozhuku Vaar
explanation: Thus let them act who dwell beneath of warlike kings the palace-roof

text:
மன்னர் விழைப விழையாமை மன்னரால்
மன்னிய ஆக்கந் தரும்.
translation: Crave not for things which kings desire  This brings thee their fruitful favour
transliteration:
Mannar Vizhaipa Vizhaiyaamai Mannaraal
Manniya Aakkan Tharum
explanation: For ministers not to cover the things desired by their kings will through the kings themselves yield them everlasting wealth

text:
போற்றின் அரியவை போற்றல் கடுத்தபின்
தேற்றுதல் யார்க்கும் அரிது.
translation: Guard thyself from petty excess Suspected least, there's no redress
transliteration:
Potrin Ariyavai Potral Katuththapin
Thetrudhal Yaarkkum Aridhu
explanation: Ministers who would save themselves should avoid (the commission of) serious errors for if the king's suspicion is once roused, no one can remove it

text:
செவிச்சொல்லும் சேர்ந்த நகையும் அவித்தொழுகல்
ஆன்ற பெரியா ரகத்து.
translation: Whisper not; nor smile exchange Amidst august men's assemblage
transliteration:
Sevichchollum Serndha Nakaiyum Aviththozhukal
Aandra Periyaa Rakaththu
explanation: While in the presence of the sovereign, ministers should neither whisper to nor smile at others

text:
எப்பொருளும் ஓரார் தொடரார்மற் றப்பொருளை
விட்டக்கால் கேட்க மறை.
translation: Hear not, ask not the king's secret Hear only when he lets it out
transliteration:
Epporulum Oraar Thotaraarmar Rapporulai
Vittakkaal Ketka Marai
explanation: (When the king is engaged) in secret counsel (with others), ministers should neither over-hear anything whatever nor pry into it with inquisitive questions, but (wait to) listen when it is divulged (by

text:
குறிப்பறிந்து காலங் கருதி வெறுப்பில
வேண்டுப வேட்பச் சொலல்.
translation: Discern his mood and time and tell No dislikes but what king likes well
transliteration:
Kuripparindhu Kaalang Karudhi Veruppila
Ventupa Vetpach Cholal
explanation: Knowing the (king's disposition and seeking the right time, (the minister) should in a pleasing manner suggest things such as are desirable and not disagreeable

text:
வேட்பன சொல்லி வினையில எஞ்ஞான்றும்
கேட்பினும் சொல்லா விடல்.
translation: Tell pleasing things; and never tell Even if pressed what is futile
transliteration:
Vetpana Solli Vinaiyila Egngnaandrum
Ketpinum Sollaa Vital
explanation: Ministers should (always) give agreeable advice but on no occasion recommend useless actions, though requested (to do so)

text:
இளையர் இனமுறையர் என்றிகழார் நின்ற
ஒளியோடு ஒழுகப் படும்.
translation: As young and kinsman do not slight; Look with awe king's light and might
transliteration:
Ilaiyar Inamuraiyar Endrikazhaar Nindra
Oliyotu Ozhukap Patum
explanation: Ministers should behave in accordance with the (Divine) light in the person of kings and not despise them saying, "He is our junior (in age) and connected with our family!"

text:
கொளப்பட்டேம் என்றெண்ணிக் கொள்ளாத செய்யார்
துளக்கற்ற காட்சி யவர்.
translation: The clear-visioned do nothing base Deeming they have the monarch's grace
transliteration:
Kolappattem Endrennik Kollaadha Seyyaar
Thulakkatra Kaatchi Yavar
explanation: Those whose judgement is firm will not do what is disagreeable (to the sovereign) saying (within

text:
பழையம் எனக்கருதிப் பண்பல்ல செய்யும்
கெழுதகைமை கேடு தரும்.
translation: Worthless acts based on friendship old  Shall spell ruin and woe untold
transliteration:
Pazhaiyam Enakkarudhip Panpalla Seyyum
Kezhudhakaimai Ketu Tharum
explanation: The (foolish) claim with which a minister does unbecoming acts because of his (long) familiarity (with the king) will ensure his ruin

text:
கூறாமை நோக்க஧க் குறிப்பறிவான் எஞ்ஞான்றும்
மாறாநீர் வையக் கணி.
translation: Who reads the mind by look, untold Adorns the changeless sea-girt world
transliteration:
Kooraamai Nokkake Kuripparivaan Egngnaandrum
Maaraaneer Vaiyak Kani
explanation: The minister who by looking (at the king) understands his mind without being told (of it), will be a perpetual ornament to the world which is surrounded by a never-drying sea

text:
ஐயப் படாஅது அகத்தது உணர்வானைத்
தெய்வத்தோ டொப்பக் கொளல்.
translation: Take him as God who reads the thought Of another man with without a doubt
transliteration:
Aiyap Pataaadhu Akaththadhu Unarvaanaith
Theyvaththo Toppak Kolal
explanation: He is to be esteemed a god who is able to ascertain without a doubt what is within (one's mind)

text:
குறிப்பிற் குறிப்புணர் வாரை உறுப்பினுள்
யாது கொடுத்தும் கொளல்.
translation: By sign who scans the sign admit At any cost in cabinet
transliteration:
Kurippir Kurippunar Vaarai Uruppinul
Yaadhu Kotuththum Kolal
explanation: The king should ever give whatever (is asked) of his belongings and secure him who, by the indications (of his own mind) is able to read those of another

text:
குறித்தது கூறாமைக் கொள்வாரோ டேனை
உறுப்போ ரனையரால் வேறு.
translation: Untold, he who divines the thought Though same in form is quite apart
transliteration:
Kuriththadhu Kooraamaik Kolvaaro Tenai
Uruppo Ranaiyaraal Veru
explanation: Those who understand one's thoughts without being informed (thereof) and those who do not, may (indeed) resemble one another bodily; still are they different (mentally)

text:
குறிப்பிற் குறிப்புணரா வாயின் உறுப்பினுள்
என்ன பயத்தவோ கண்?
translation: Among senses what for is eye If thought by thought one can't descry?
transliteration:
Kurippir Kurippunaraa Vaayin Uruppinul
Enna Payaththavo Kan?
explanation: Of what use are the eyes amongst one's members, if they cannot by their own indications dive those of another ?

text:
அடுத்தது காட்டும் பளிங்குபோல் நெஞ்சம்
கடுத்தது காட்டும் முகம்.
translation: What throbs in mind the face reflects Just as mirror nearby objects
transliteration:
Atuththadhu Kaattum Palingupol Nenjam
Katuththadhu Kaattum Mukam
explanation: As the mirror reflects what is near so does the face show what is uppermost in the mind

text:
முகத்தின் முதுக்குறைந்தது உண்டோ உவப்பினும்
காயினும் தான்முந் துறும்.
translation: Than face what is subtler to tell First if the mind feels well or ill
transliteration:
Mukaththin Mudhukkuraindhadhu Unto Uvappinum
Kaayinum Thaanmun Thurum
explanation: Is there anything so full of knowledge as the face ? (No) it precedes the mind, whether (the latter is) pleased or vexed

text:
முகம்நோக்கி நிற்க அமையும் அகம்நோக்கி
உற்ற துணர்வார்ப் பெறின்.
translation: Just standing in front would suffice For those who read the mind on face
transliteration:
Mukamnokki Nirka Amaiyum Akamnokki
Utra Thunarvaarp Perin
explanation: If the king gets those who by looking into his mind can understand (and remove) what has occurred (to him) it is enough that he stand looking at their face

text:
பகைமையும் கேண்மையும் கண்ணுரைக்கும் கண்ணின்
வகைமை உணர்வார்ப் பெறின்.
translation: Friend or foe the eyes will show To those who changing outlooks know
transliteration:
Pakaimaiyum Kenmaiyum Kannuraikkum Kannin
Vakaimai Unarvaarp Perin
explanation: If a king gets ministers who can read the movements of the eye, the eyes (of foreign kings) will (themselves) reveal (to him) their hatred or friendship

text:
நுண்ணியம் என்பார் அளக்குங்கோல் காணுங்கால்
கண்ணல்லது இல்லை பிற.
translation: The scale of keen discerning minds  Is eye and eye that secrets finds
transliteration:
Nunniyam Enpaar Alakkungol Kaanungaal
Kannalladhu Illai Pira
explanation: The measuring-rod of those (ministers) who say "we are acute" will on inquiry be found to be their (own) eyes and nothing else

text:
அவையறிநது ஆராய்ந்து சொல்லுக சொல்லின்
தொகையறிந்த தூய்மை யவர்.
translation: The pure in thought and eloquence  Adapt their words to audience
transliteration:
Avaiyarinadhu Aaraaindhu Solluka Sollin
Thokaiyarindha Thooimai Yavar
explanation: Let the pure who know the arrangement of words speak with deliberation after ascertaining (the nature of) the court (then assembled)

text:
இடைதெரிந்து நன்குணர்ந்து சொல்லுக சொல்லின்
நடைதெரிந்த நன்மை யவர்.
translation: Who know the art of speech shall suit Their chosen words to time in fact
transliteration:
Itaidherindhu Nankunarndhu Solluka Sollin
Nataidherindha Nanmai Yavar
explanation: Let the good who know the uses of words speak with a clear knowledge after ascertaining the time (suited to the court)

text:
அவையறியார் சொல்லல்மேற் கொள்பவர் சொல்லின்
வகையறியார் வல்லதூஉம் இல்.
translation: They speak in vain at length who talk Words unversed which ears don't take
transliteration:
Avaiyariyaar Sollalmer Kolpavar Sollin
Vakaiyariyaar Valladhooum Il
explanation: Those who undertake to speak without knowing the (nature of the) court are ignorant of the quality of words as well as devoid of the power (of learning)

text:
ஒளியார்முன் ஒள்ளிய ராதல் வெளியார்முன்
வான்சுதை வண்ணம் கொளல்.
translation: Before the bright be brilliant light Before the muff be mortar white
transliteration:
Oliyaarmun Olliya Raadhal Veliyaarmun
Vaansudhai Vannam Kolal
explanation: Ministers should be lights in the assembly of the enlightned, but assume the pure whiteness of mortar (ignorance) in that of fools

text:
நன்றென்ற வற்றுள்ளும் நன்றே முதுவருள்
முந்து கிளவாச் செறிவு.
translation: Modest restraint all good excels Which argues not before elders
transliteration:
Nandrendra Vatrullum Nandre Mudhuvarul
Mundhu Kilavaach Cherivu
explanation: The modesty by which one does not rush forward and speak in (an assembly of) superiors is the best among all (one's) good qualities

text:
ஆற்றின் நிலைதளர்ந் தற்றே வியன்புலம்
ஏற்றுணர்வார் முன்னர் இழுக்கு.
translation: Tongue-slip before the talented wise is like slipping from righteous ways
transliteration:
Aatrin Nilaidhalarn Thatre Viyanpulam
Etrunarvaar Munnar Izhukku
explanation: (For a minister) to blunder in the presence of those who have acquired a vast store of learning and know (the value thereof) is like a good man stumbling (and falling away) from the path (of virtue)

text:
கற்றறிந்தார் கல்வி விளங்கும் கசடறச்
சொல்தெரிதல் வல்லார் அகத்து.
translation: The learning of the learned shines Valued by flawless scholar-minds
transliteration:
Katrarindhaar Kalvi Vilangum Kasatarach
Choldheridhal Vallaar Akaththu
explanation: The learning of those who have read and understood (much) will shine in the assembly of those who faultlessly examine (the nature of) words

text:
உணர்வ துடையார்முன் சொல்லல் வளர்வதன்
பாத்தியுள் நீர்சொரிந் தற்று.
translation: To address understanding ones Is to water beds of growing grains
transliteration:
Unarva Thutaiyaarmun Sollal Valarvadhan
Paaththiyul Neersorin Thatru
explanation: Lecturing to those who have the ability to understand (for themselves) is like watering a bed of plants that are growing (of themselves)

text:
புல்லவையுள் பொச்சாந்தும் சொல்லற்க நல்லவையுள்
நன்குசலச் சொல்லு வார்.
translation: O ye who speak before the keen Forgetful, address not the mean
transliteration:
Pullavaiyul Pochchaandhum Sollarka Nallavaiyul
Nankusalach Chollu Vaar
explanation: Those who are able to speak good things impressively in an assembly of the good should not even forgetfully speak them in that of the low

text:
அங்கணத்துள் உக்க அமிழ்தற்றால் தங்கணத்தார்
அல்லார்முன் கோட்டி கொளல்.
translation: To hostiles who wise words utters Pours ambrosia into gutters
transliteration:
Anganaththul Ukka Amizhdhatraal Thanganaththaar
Allaarmun Kotti Kolal
explanation: To utter (a good word) in the assembly of those who are of inferior rank is like dropping nectar on the ground

text:
வகையறிந்து வல்லவை வாய்சோரார் சொல்லின்
தொகையறிந்த தூய்மை யவர்.
translation: The pure fail not in power of words Knowing grand council's moods and modes
transliteration:
Vakaiyarindhu Vallavai Vaaisoraar Sollin
Thokaiyarindha Thooimai Yavar
explanation: The pure who know the classification of words having first ascertained the nature (of the court) will not (through fear) falter in their speech before the powerful body

text:
கற்றாருள் கற்றார் எனப்படுவர் கற்றார்முன்
கற்ற செலச்சொல்லு வார்.
translation: Among scholars he is scholar Who holds scholars with learned lore
transliteration:
Katraarul Katraar Enappatuvar Katraarmun
Katra Selachchollu Vaar
explanation: Those who can agreeably set forth their acquirements before the learned will be regarded as the most learned among the learned

text:
பகையகத்துச் சாவார் எளியர் அரியர்
அவையகத்து அஞ்சா தவர்.
translation: Many brave foes and die in fields The fearless few face wise councils
transliteration:
Pakaiyakaththuch Chaavaar Eliyar Ariyar
Avaiyakaththu Anjaa Thavar
explanation: Many indeed may (fearlessly) die in the presence of (their) foes; (but) few are those who are fearless in the assembly (of the learned)

text:
கற்றார்முன் கற்ற செலச்சொல்லித் தாம்கற்ற
மிக்காருள் மிக்க கொளல்.
translation: Impress the learned with your lore From greater savants learn still more
transliteration:
Katraarmun Katra Selachchollith Thaamkatra
Mikkaarul Mikka Kolal
explanation: (Ministers) should agreeably set forth their acquirements before the learned and acquire more (knowledge) from their superiors (in learning)

text:
ஆற்றின் அளவறிந்து கற்க அவையஞ்சா
மாற்றங் கொடுத்தற் பொருட்டு.
translation: Grammar and logic learn so that Foes you can boldly retort
transliteration:
Aatrin Alavarindhu Karka Avaiyanjaa
Maatrang Kotuththar Poruttu
explanation: In order to reply fearlessly before a foreign court, (ministers) should learn logic according to the rules (of grammar)

text:
வாளொடென் வன்கண்ணர் அல்லார்க்கு நூலொடென்
நுண்ணவை அஞ்சு பவர்க்கு.
translation: To cowards what can sword avail And books to those who councils fail?
transliteration:
Vaaloten Vankannar Allaarkku Nooloten
Nunnavai Anju Pavarkku
explanation: What have they to do with a sword who are not valiant, or they with learning who are afraid of an intelligent assembly ?

text:
பகையகத்துப் பேடிகை ஒள்வாள் அவையகத்து
அஞ்சு மவன்கற்ற நூல்.
translation: Like eunuch's sword in field, is vain His lore who fears men of brain
transliteration:
Pakaiyakaththup Petikai Olvaal Avaiyakaththu
Anju Mavankatra Nool
explanation: The learning of him who is diffident before an assembly is like the shining sword of an hermaphrodite in the presence of his foes

text:
பல்லவை கற்றும் பயமிலரே நல்லவையுள்
நன்கு செலச்சொல்லா தார்.
translation: Though learned much his lore is dead Who says no good before the good
transliteration:
Pallavai Katrum Payamilare Nallavaiyul
Nanku Selachchollaa Thaar
explanation: Those who cannot agreeably speak good things before a good assembly are indeed unprofitable persons inspite of all their various acquirements

text:
கல்லா தவரின் கடையென்ப கற்றறிந்தும்
நல்லா ரவையஞ்சு வார்.
translation: Who fear to face good assembly Are learned idiots, certainly
transliteration:
Kallaa Thavarin Kataiyenpa Katrarindhum
Nallaa Ravaiyanju Vaar
explanation: They who, though they have learned and understood, are yet afraid of the assembly of the good, are said to be inferior (even) to the illiterate

text:
உளரெனினும் இல்லாரொடு ஒப்பர் களன்அஞ்சிக்
கற்ற செலச்சொல்லா தார்.
translation: They are breathing dead who dare not Empress before the wise their art
transliteration:
Ulareninum Illaarotu Oppar Kalananjik
Katra Selachchollaa Thaar
explanation: Those who through fear of the assembly are unable to set forth their learning in an interesting manner, though alive, are yet like the dead

text:
தள்ளா விளையுளும் தக்காரும் தாழ்விலாச்
செல்வரும் சேர்வது நாடு.
translation: It's country which has souls of worth Unfailing yields and ample wealth
transliteration:
Thallaa Vilaiyulum Thakkaarum Thaazhvilaach
Chelvarum Servadhu Naatu
explanation: A kingdom is that in which (those who carry on) a complete cultivation, virtuous persons, and

text:
பெரும்பொருளால் பெட்டக்க தாகி அருங்கேட்டால்
ஆற்ற விளைவது நாடு.
translation: The Land has large luring treasure Where pests are nil and yields are sure
transliteration:
Perumporulaal Pettakka Thaaki Arungettaal
Aatra Vilaivadhu Naatu
explanation: A kingdom is that which is desire for its immense wealth, and which grows greatly in prosperity, being free from destructive causes

text:
பொறையொருங்கு மேல்வருங்கால் தாங்கி இறைவற்கு
இறையொருங்கு நேர்வது நாடு.
translation: It's land that bears pressing burdens And pays its tax which king demands
transliteration:
Poraiyorungu Melvarungaal Thaangi Iraivarku
Iraiyorungu Nervadhu Naatu
explanation: A kingdom is that which can bear any burden that may be pressed on it (from adjoining kingdoms) and (yet) pay the full tribute to its sovereign

text:
உறுபசியும் ஓவாப் பிணியும் செறுபகையும்
சேரா தியல்வது நாடு.
translation: It is country which is free from Fierce famine, plague and foemen's harm
transliteration:
Urupasiyum Ovaap Piniyum Serupakaiyum
Seraa Thiyalvadhu Naatu
explanation: A kingdom is that which continues to be free from excessive starvation, irremediable epidemics, and destructive foes

text:
பல்குழுவும் பாழ்செய்யும் உட்பகையும் வேந்தலைக்கும்
கொல்குறும்பும் இல்லது நாடு.
translation: Sects and ruinous foes are nil No traitors in a land tranquil
transliteration:
Palkuzhuvum Paazhseyyum Utpakaiyum Vendhalaikkum
Kolkurumpum Illadhu Naatu
explanation: A kingdom is that which is without various (irregular) associations, destructive internal enemies, and murderous savages who (sometimes) harass the sovereign

text:
கேடறியாக் கெட்ட இடத்தும் வளங்குன்றா
நாடென்ப நாட்டின் தலை.
translation: The land of lands no ruin knows Even in grief its wealth yet grows
transliteration:
Ketariyaak Ketta Itaththum Valangundraa
Naatenpa Naattin Thalai
explanation: The learned say that the best kingdom is that which knows no evil (from its foes), and, if injured (at all), suffers no diminution in its fruitfulness

text:
இருபுனலும் வாய்ந்த மலையும் வருபுனலும்
வல்லரணும் நாட்டிற்கு உறுப்பு.
translation: Waters up and down, hills and streams With strong forts as limbs country beams
transliteration:
Irupunalum Vaaindha Malaiyum Varupunalum
Vallaranum Naattirku Uruppu
explanation: The constituents of a kingdom are the two waters (from above and below), well situated hills and an undestructible fort

text:
பிணியின்மை செல்வம் விளைவின்பம் ஏமம்
அணியென்ப நாட்டிவ் வைந்து.
translation: Rich yield, delight, defence and wealth Are jewels of lands with blooming health
transliteration:
Piniyinmai Selvam Vilaivinpam Emam
Aniyenpa Naattiv Vaindhu
explanation: Freedom from epidemics, wealth, produce, happiness and protection (to subjects); these five, the learned, say, are the ornaments of a kingdom

text:
நாடென்ப நாடா வளத்தன நாடல்ல
நாட வளந்தரு நாடு.
translation: A land is land which yields unsought Needing hard work the land is nought
transliteration:
Naatenpa Naataa Valaththana Naatalla
Naata Valandharu Naatu
explanation: The learned say that those are kingdom whose wealth is not laboured for, and those not, whose wealth is only obtained through labour

text:
ஆங்கமை வெய்தியக் கண்ணும் பயமின்றே
வேந்தமை வில்லாத நாடு.
translation: Though a land has thus every thing It is worthless without a king
transliteration:
Aangamai Veydhiyak Kannum Payamindre
Vendhamai Villaadha Naatu
explanation: Although in possession of all the above mentioned excellences, these are indeed of no use to a country, in the absence of harmony between the sovereign and the sujects

text:
ஆற்று பவர்க்கும் அரண்பொருள் அஞ்சித்தற்
போற்று பவர்க்கும் பொருள்.
translation: The fort is vital for offence Who fear the foes has its defence
transliteration:
Aatru Pavarkkum Aranporul Anjiththar
Potru Pavarkkum Porul
explanation: A fort is an object of importance to those who march (against their foes) as well as to those who through fear (of pursuers) would seek it for shelter

text:
மணிநீரும் மண்ணும் மலையும் அணிநிழற்
காடும் உடைய தரண்.
translation: A crystal fount, a space a mount Thick woods form a fort paramount
transliteration:
Manineerum Mannum Malaiyum Aninizhar
Kaatum Utaiya Tharan
explanation: A fort is that which has everlasting water, plains, mountains and cool shady forests

text:
உயர்வகலம் திண்மை அருமைஇந் நான்கின்
அமைவரண் என்றுரைக்கும் நூல்.
translation: An ideal fort's so says science: High, broad, strong and hard for access
transliteration:
Uyarvakalam Thinmai Arumaiin Naankin
Amaivaran Endruraikkum Nool
explanation: The learned say that a fortress is an enclosure having these four (qualities) viz, height, breadth, strength and inaccessibility

text:
சிறுகாப்பிற் பேரிடத்த தாகி உறுபகை
ஊக்கம் அழிப்ப தரண்.
translation: Ample in space, easy to hold The fort foils enemies bold
transliteration:
Sirukaappir Peritaththa Thaaki Urupakai
Ookkam Azhippa Tharan
explanation: A fort is that which has an extensive space within, but only small places to be guarded, and such as can destroy the courage of besieging foes

text:
கொளற்கரிதாய்க் கொண்டகூழ்த் தாகி அகத்தார்
நிலைக்கெளிதாம் நீரது அரண்.
translation: Impregnable with stores of food Cosy to live-That fort is good
transliteration:
Kolarkaridhaaik Kontakoozhth Thaaki Akaththaar
Nilaikkelidhaam Neeradhu Aran
explanation: A fort is that which cannot be captured, which abounds in suitable provisions, and affords a position of easy defence to its inmates

text:
எல்லாப் பொருளும் உடைத்தாய் இடத்துதவும்
நல்லாள் உடையது அரண்.
translation: A fort is full of stores and arms And brave heroes to meet alarms
transliteration:
Ellaap Porulum Utaiththaai Itaththudhavum
Nallaal Utaiyadhu Aran
explanation: A fort is that which has all (needful) things, and excellent heroes that can help it against destruction (by foes)

text:
முற்றியும் முற்றா தெறிந்தும் அறைப்படுத்தும்
பற்றற் கரியது அரண்.
translation: Besieging foes a fort withstands Darts and mines of treacherous hands
transliteration:
Mutriyum Mutraa Therindhum Araippatuththum
Patrar Kariyadhu Aran
explanation: A fort is that which cannot be captured by blockading, assaulting, or undermining it

text:
முற்றாற்றி முற்றி யவரையும் பற்றாற்றிப்
பற்றியார் வெல்வது அரண்.
translation: A fort holds itself and defies The attacks of encircling foes
transliteration:
Mutraatri Mutri Yavaraiyum Patraatrip
Patriyaar Velvadhu Aran
explanation: That is a fort whose inmates are able to overcome without losing their ground, even abler men who have besieged it

text:
முனைமுகத்து மாற்றலர் சாய வினைமுகத்து
வீறெய்தி மாண்ட தரண்.
translation: A fort it is that fells the foes And gains by deeds a name glorious
transliteration:
Munaimukaththu Maatralar Saaya Vinaimukaththu
Veereydhi Maanta Tharan
explanation: A fort is that which derives excellence from the stratagems made (by its inmates) to defeat their enemies in the battlefield

text:
எனைமாட்சித் தாகியக் கண்ணும் வினைமாட்சி
இல்லார்கண் இல்லது அரண்.
translation: But a fort however grand Is nil if heroes do not stand
transliteration:
Enaimaatchith Thaakiyak Kannum Vinaimaatchi
Illaarkan Illadhu Aran
explanation: Although a fort may possess all (the above-said) excellence, it is, as it were without these, if its inmates possess not the excellence of action

text:
பொருளல் லவரைப் பொருளாகச் செய்யும்
பொருளல்லது இல்லை பொருள்.
translation: Naught exists that can, save wealth Make the worthless as men of worth
transliteration:
Porulal Lavaraip Porulaakach Cheyyum
Porulalladhu Illai Porul
explanation: Besides wealth there is nothing that can change people of no importance into those of (some) importance

text:
இல்லாரை எல்லாரும் எள்ளுவர் செல்வரை
எல்லாரும் செய்வர் சிறப்பு.
translation: The have-nothing poor all despise The men of wealth all raise and praise
transliteration:
Illaarai Ellaarum Elluvar Selvarai
Ellaarum Seyvar Sirappu
explanation: All despise the poor; (but) all praise the rich

text:
பொருளென்னும் பொய்யா விளக்கம் இருளறுக்கும்
எண்ணிய தேயத்துச் சென்று.
translation: Waneless wealth is light that goes To every land and gloom removes
transliteration:
Porulennum Poiyaa Vilakkam Irularukkum
Enniya Theyaththuch Chendru
explanation: The imperishable light of wealth goes into regions desired (by its owner) and destroys the darkness (of enmity therein)

text:
அறன்ஈனும் இன்பமும் ஈனும் திறனறிந்து
தீதின்றி வந்த பொருள்.
translation: The blameless wealth from fairest means Brings good virtue and also bliss
transliteration:
Araneenum Inpamum Eenum Thiranarindhu
Theedhindri Vandha Porul
explanation: The wealth acquired with a knowledge of the proper means and without foul practices will yield virtue and happiness

text:
அருளொடும் அன்பொடும் வாராப் பொருளாக்கம்
புல்லார் புரள விடல்.
translation: Riches devoid of love and grace Off with it; it is disgrace!
transliteration:
Arulotum Anpotum Vaaraap Porulaakkam
Pullaar Purala Vital
explanation: (Kings) should rather avoid than seek the accumulation of wealth which does not flow in with mercy and love

text:
உறுபொருளும் உல்கு பொருளும்தன் ஒன்னார்த்
தெறுபொருளும் வேந்தன் பொருள்.
translation: Escheats, derelicts; spoils of war Taxes duties are king's treasure
transliteration:
Uruporulum Ulku Porulumdhan Onnaarth
Theruporulum Vendhan Porul
explanation: The spoils of slaughtered foes; these are the royal revenues

text:
அருளென்னும் அன்பீன் குழவி பொருளென்னும்
செல்வச் செவிலியால் உண்டு.
translation: Grace the child of love is nourished By the wet-nurse of wealth cherished
transliteration:
Arulennum Anpeen Kuzhavi Porulennum
Selvach Cheviliyaal Untu
explanation: The child mercy which is borne by love grows under the care of the rich nurse of wealth

text:
குன்றேறி யானைப் போர் கண்டற்றால் தன்கைத்தொன்று
உண்டாகச் செய்வான் வினை.
translation: Treasures in hand fulfil all things Like hill-tuskers the wars of kings
transliteration:
Kundreri Yaanaip Por Kantatraal
Thankaiththondru Untaakach Cheyvaan Vinai
explanation: An undertaking of one who has wealth in one's hands is like viewing an elephant-fight from a hill-top

text:
செய்க பொருளைச் செறுநர் செருக்கறுக்கும்
எஃகதனிற் கூரிய தில்.
translation: Make wealth; there is no sharper steel The insolence of foes to quell
transliteration:
Seyka Porulaich Cherunar Serukkarukkum
Eqkadhanir Kooriya Thil
explanation: Accumulate wealth; it will destroy the arrogance of (your) foes; there is no weapon sharper than it

text:
ஒண்பொருள் காழ்ப்ப இயற்றியார்க்கு எண்பொருள்
ஏனை இரண்டும் ஒருங்கு.
translation: They have joy and virtue at hand Who acquire treasures abundant
transliteration:
Onporul Kaazhppa Iyatriyaarkku Enporul
Enai Irantum Orungu
explanation: To those who have honestly acquired an abundance of riches, the other two, (virtue and pleasure) are things easy (of acquisition)

text:
உறுப்பமைந்து ஊறஞ்சா வெல்படை வேந்தன்
வெறுக்கையுள் எல்லாம் தலை.
translation: The daring well-armed winning force Is king's treasure and main resource
transliteration:
Uruppamaindhu Ooranjaa Velpatai Vendhan
Verukkaiyul Ellaam Thalai
explanation: The army which is complete in (its) parts and conquers without fear of wounds is the chief wealth of the king

text:
உலைவிடத்து ஊறஞ்சா வன்கண் தொலைவிடத்துத்
தொல்படைக் கல்லால் அரிது.
translation: Through shots and wounds brave heroes hold Quailing not in fall, the field
transliteration:
Ulaivitaththu Ooranjaa Vankan Tholaivitaththuth
Tholpataik Kallaal Aridhu
explanation: Ancient army can alone have the valour which makes it stand by its king at the time of defeat, fearless of wounds and unmindful of its reduced strength

text:
ஒலித்தக்கால் என்னாம் உவரி எலிப்பகை
நாகம் உயிர்ப்பக் கெடும்.
translation: Sea-like ratfoes roar What if? They perish at a cobra's whiff
transliteration:
Oliththakkaal Ennaam Uvari Ela�ppakai
Naakam Uyirppak Ketum
explanation: What if (a host of) hostile rats roar like the sea ? They will perish at the mere breath of the cobra

text:
அழிவின்றி அறைபோகா தாகி வழிவந்த
வன்க ணதுவே படை.
translation: The army guards its genial flame Not crushed, routed nor marred in name
transliteration:
Azhivindri Araipokaa Thaaki Vazhivandha
Vanka Nadhuve Patai
explanation: That indeed is an army which has stood firm of old without suffering destruction or deserting (to the enemy)

text:
கூற்றுடன்று மேல்வரினும் கூடி எதிர்நிற்கும்
ஆற்ற லதுவே படை.
translation: The real army with rallied force Resists even Death-God fierce
transliteration:
Kootrutandru Melvarinum Kooti Edhirnirkum
Aatra Ladhuve Patai
explanation: That indeed is an army which is capable of offering a united resistance, even if Yama advances against it with fury

text:
மறமானம் மாண்ட வழிச்செலவு தேற்றம்
எனநான்கே ஏமம் படைக்கு.
translation: Manly army has merits four:- Stately-march, faith, honour, valour
transliteration:
Maramaanam Maanta Vazhichchelavu Thetram
Enanaanke Emam Pataikku
explanation: Valour, honour, following in the excellent-footsteps (of its predecessors) and trust-worthiness; these four alone constitute the safeguard of an army

text:
தார்தாங்கிச் செல்வது தானை தலைவந்த
போர்தாங்கும் தன்மை அறிந்து.
translation: Army sets on to face to foes Knowing how the trend of war goes
transliteration:
Thaardhaangich Chelvadhu Thaanai Thalaivandha
Pordhaangum Thanmai Arindhu
explanation: That is an army which knowing the art of warding off an impending struggle, can bear against the dust-van (of a hostile force)

text:
அடல்தகையும் ஆற்றலும் இல்லெனினும் தானை
படைத்தகையால் பாடு பெறும்.
translation: Army gains force by grand array Lacking in stay or dash in fray
transliteration:
Ataldhakaiyum Aatralum Illeninum Thaanai
Pataiththakaiyaal Paatu Perum
explanation: Though destitute of courage to fight and strength (to endure), an army may yet gain renown by the splendour of its appearance

text:
சிறுமையும் செல்லாத் துனியும் வறுமையும்
இல்லாயின் வெல்லும் படை.
translation: Army shall win if it is free From weakness, aversion, poverty
transliteration:
Sirumaiyum Sellaath Thuniyum Varumaiyum
Illaayin Vellum Patai
explanation: An army can triumph (over its foes) if it is free from diminution; irremediable aversion and poverty

text:
நிலைமக்கள் சால உடைத்தெனினும் தானை
தலைமக்கள் இல்வழி இல்.
translation: With troops in large numbers on rolls Army can't march missing gen'rals
transliteration:
Nilaimakkal Saala Utaiththeninum Thaanai
Thalaimakkal Ilvazhi Il
explanation: Though an army may contain a large number of permanent soldiers, it cannot last if it has no generals

text:
என்னைமுன் நில்லன்மின் தெவ்விர் பலரென்னை
முன்நின்று கல்நின் றவர்.
translation: Stand not before my chief, O foes! Many who stood, in stones repose
transliteration:
Ennaimun Nillanmin Thevvir Palarennai
Munnindru Kalnin Ravar
explanation: O my foes, stand not before my leader; (for) many are those who did so but afterwards stood (in the shape of) statues

text:
கான முயலெய்த அம்பினில் யானை
பிழைத்தவேல் ஏந்தல் இனிது.
translation: To lift a lance that missed a tusker Is prouder than shaft that hit a hare
transliteration:
Kaana Muyaleydha Ampinil Yaanai
Pizhaiththavel Endhal Inidhu
explanation: It is more pleasant to hold the dart that has missed an elephant than that which has hit hare in the forest

text:
பேராண்மை என்ப தறுகண்ஒன் றுற்றக்கால்
ஊராண்மை மற்றதன் எஃகு.
translation: Valour is fight with fierce courage Mercy to the fallen is its edge
transliteration:
Peraanmai Enpa Tharukanon Rutrakkaal
Ooraanmai Matradhan Eqku
explanation: The learned say that fierceness (incontest with a foe) is indeed great valour; but to become a benefactor in case of accident (to a foe) is the extreme (limit) of that valour

text:
கைவேல் களிற்றொடு போக்கி வருபவன்
மெய்வேல் பறியா நகும்.
translation: At the tusker he flings his lance One in body smiles another chance
transliteration:
Kaivel Kalitrotu Pokki Varupavan
Meyvel Pariyaa Nakum
explanation: The hero who after casting the lance in his hand on an elephant, comes (in search of another) will pluck the one (that sticks) in his body and laugh (exultingly)

text:
விழித்தகண் வேல்கொண டெறிய அழித்திமைப்பின்
ஒட்டன்றோ வன்க ணவர்க்கு.
translation: When lances dart if heroes wink \"It is a rout\" the world will think
transliteration:
Vizhiththakan Velkona Teriya Azhiththimaippin
Ottandro Vanka Navarkku
explanation: Is it not a defeat to the valiant to wink and destroy their ferocious look when a lance in cast at them (by their foe) ?

text:
விழுப்புண் படாதநாள் எல்லாம் வழுக்கினுள்
வைக்கும்தன் நாளை எடுத்து.
translation: The brave shall deem the days as vain Which did not battle-wounds sustain
transliteration:
Vizhuppun Pataadhanaal Ellaam Vazhukkinul
Vaikkumdhan Naalai Etuththu
explanation: The hero will reckon among wasted days all those on which he had not received severe wounds

text:
சுழலும் இசைவேண்டி வேண்டா உயிரார்
கழல்யாப்புக் காரிகை நீர்த்து.
translation: Their anklets aloud jingle their name Who sacrifice their life for fame
transliteration:
Suzhalum Isaiventi Ventaa Uyiraar
Kazhalyaappuk Kaarikai Neerththu
explanation: The fastening of ankle-ring by those who disire a world-wide renown and not (the safety of) their lives is like adorning (themselves)

text:
உறின்உயிர் அஞ்சா மறவர் இறைவன்
செறினும் சீர்குன்றல் இலர்.
translation: The king may chide, they pursue strife; They fear loss of glory; not life
transliteration:
Urinuyir Anjaa Maravar Iraivan
Serinum Seerkundral Ilar
explanation: The heroes who are not afraid of losing their life in a contest will not cool their ardour, even if the king prohibits (their fighting)

text:
இழைத்தது இகவாமைச் சாவாரை யாரே
பிழைத்தது ஒறுக்கிற் பவர்.
translation: Who will blame the heroes that lose Their lives in war to keep their vows?
transliteration:
Izhaiththadhu Ikavaamaich Chaavaarai Yaare
Pizhaiththadhu Orukkir Pavar
explanation: Who would reproach with failure those who seal their oath with their death ?

text:
புரந்தார்கண் நீர்மல்கச் சாகிற்பின் சாக்காடு
இரந்துகோள் தக்கது உடைத்து.
translation: Such a death shall be prayed for Which draws the the tears of the ruler
transliteration:
Purandhaarkan Neermalkach Chaakirpin Saakkaatu
Irandhukol Thakkadhu Utaiththu
explanation: If (heroes) can so die as to fill with tears the eyes of their rulers, such a death deserves to be obtained even by begging

text:
செயற்கரிய யாவுள நட்பின் அதுபோல்
வினைக்கரிய யாவுள காப்பு.
translation: Like friendship what's so hard to gain? That guards one against acts villain?
transliteration:
Seyarkariya Yaavula Natpin Adhupol
Vinaikkariya Yaavula Kaappu
explanation: What so sure defence 'gainst all that foe can do?

text:
நிறைநீர நீரவர் கேண்மை பிறைமதிப்
பின்னீர பேதையார் நட்பு.
translation: Good friendship shines like waxing moon, The bad withers like waning moon
transliteration:
Niraineera Neeravar Kenmai Piraimadhip
Pinneera Pedhaiyaar Natpu
explanation: The friendship of the wise waxes like the new moon; (but) that of fools wanes like the full moon

text:
நவில்தொறும் நூல்நயம் போலும் பயில்தொறும்
பண்புடை யாளர் தொடர்பு.
translation: Like taste in books good friendship grows The more one moves the more he knows
transliteration:
Navildhorum Noolnayam Polum Payildhorum
Panputai Yaalar Thotarpu
explanation: Like learning, the friendship of the noble, the more it is cultivated, the more delightful does it become

text:
நகுதற் பொருட்டன்று நட்டல் மிகுதிக்கண்
மேற்செனறு இடித்தற் பொருட்டு.
translation: Not to laugh is friendship made But to hit when faults exceed
transliteration:
Nakudhar Poruttandru Nattal Mikudhikkan
Mersenaru Itiththar Poruttu
explanation: Friendship is to be practised not for the purpose of laughing but for that of being beforehand in giving one another sharp rebukes in case of transgression

text:
புணர்ச்சி பழகுதல் வேண்டா உணர்ச்சிதான்
நட்பாங் கிழமை தரும்.
translation: No close living nor clasping grip Friendship's feeling heart's fellowship
transliteration:
Punarchchi Pazhakudhal Ventaa Unarchchidhaan
Natpaang Kizhamai Tharum
explanation: Living together and holding frequent intercourse are not necessary (for friendship); (mutual) understanding can alone create a claim for it

text:
முகநக நட்பது நட்பன்று நெஞ்சத்து
அகநக நட்பது நட்பு.
translation: Friendship is not more smile on face It is the smiling heart's embrace
transliteration:
Mukanaka Natpadhu Natpandru Nenjaththu
Akanaka Natpadhu Natpu
explanation: The love that dwells (merely in the smiles of the face is not friendship; (but) that which dwells deep in the smiles of the heart is true friendship

text:
அழிவி னவைநீக்கி ஆறுய்த்து அழிவின்கண்
அல்லல் உழப்பதாம் நட்பு.
translation: From ruin friendship saves and shares The load of pain and right path shows
transliteration:
Azhivi Navaineekki Aaruyththu Azhivinkan
Allal Uzhappadhaam Natpu
explanation: (True) friendship turns aside from evil (ways) makes (him) walk in the (good) way, and, in case of loss if shares his sorrow (with him)

text:
உடுக்கை இழந்தவன் கைபோல ஆங்கே
இடுக்கண் களைவதாம் நட்பு.
translation: Friendship hastens help in mishaps Like hands picking up dress that slips
transliteration:
Utukkai Izhandhavan Kaipola Aange
Itukkan Kalaivadhaam Natpu
explanation: (True) friendship hastens to the rescue of the afflicted (as readily) as the hand of one whose garment is loosened (before an assembly)

text:
நட்பிற்கு வீற்றிருக்கை யாதெனின் கொட்பின்றி
ஒல்லும்வாய் ஊன்றும் நிலை.
translation: Friendship is enthroned on the strength That always helps with utmost warmth
transliteration:
Natpirku Veetrirukkai Yaadhenin Kotpindri
Ollumvaai Oondrum Nilai
explanation: Friendship may be said to be on its throne when it possesses the power of supporting one at all times and under all circumstances, (in the practice or virtue and wealth)

text:
இனையர் இவரெமக்கு இன்னம்யாம் என்று
புனையினும் புல்லென்னும் நட்பு.
translation: \"Such we are and such they are!\" Ev'n this boast will friendship mar
transliteration:
Inaiyar Ivaremakku Innamyaam Endru
Punaiyinum Pullennum Natpu
explanation: Though friends may praise one another saying, "He is so intimate with us, and we so much (with him)"; (still) such friendship will appear mean

text:
நாடாது நட் டலிற் கேடில்லை நட்டபின்
வீடில்லை நட்பாள் பவர்க்கு.
translation: Than testless friendship nought is worse For contacts formed will scarcely cease
transliteration:
Naataadhu Nattalir Ketillai Nattapin
Veetillai Natpaal Pavarkku
explanation: As those who are of a friendly nature will not forsake (a friend) after once loving (him), there is no evil so great as contracting a friendship without due inquiry

text:
ஆய்ந்தாய்ந்து கொள்ளாதான் கேண்மை கடைமுறை
தான்சாம் துயரம் தரும்.
translation: Friendship made without frequent test Shall end in grief and death at last
transliteration:
Aaindhaaindhu Kollaadhaan Kenmai Kataimurai
Thaansaam Thuyaram Tharum
explanation: The friendship contracted by him who has not made repeated inquiry will in the end grieve (him) to death

text:
குணமும் குடிமையும் குற்றமும் குன்றா
இனனும் அறிந்தியாக்க நட்பு.
translation: Temper, descent, defects and kins Trace well and take companions
transliteration:
Kunamum Kutimaiyum Kutramum Kundraa
Inanum Arindhiyaakka Natpu
explanation: Make friendship (with one) after ascertaining (his) character, birth, defects and the whole of one's relations

text:
குடிப்பிறந்து தன்கண் பழிநாணு வானைக்
கொடுத்தும் கொளல்வேண்டும் நட்பு.
translation: Take as good friend at any price The nobly born who shun disgrace
transliteration:
Kutippirandhu Thankan Pazhinaanu Vaanaik
Kotuththum Kolalventum Natpu
explanation: The friendship of one who belongs to a (good) family and is afraid of (being charged with) guilt, is worth even purchasing

text:
அழச்சொல்லி அல்லது இடித்து வழக்கறிய
வல்லார்நடபு ஆய்ந்து கொளல்.
translation: Who make you weep and chide wrong trends And lead you right are worthy friends
transliteration:
Azhachcholli Alladhu Itiththu Vazhakkariya
Vallaarnatapu Aaindhu Kolal
explanation: You should examine and secure the friendship of those who can speak so as to make you weep over a crime (before its commission) or rebuke you severely (after you have done it) and are able to teach

text:
கேட்டினும் உண்டோ ர் உறுதி கிளைஞரை
நீட்டி அளப்பதோர் கோல்.
translation: Is there a test like misfortune A rod to measure out kinsmen?
transliteration:
Kettinum Untor Urudhi Kilaignarai
Neetti Alappadhor Kol
explanation: Even in ruin there is some good; (for) it is a rod by which one may measure fully (the affection of one's) relations

text:
ஊதியம் என்பது ஒருவற்குப் பேதையார்
கேண்மை ஒரீஇ விடல்.
translation: Keep off contacts with fools; that is The greatest gain so say the wise
transliteration:
Oodhiyam Enpadhu Oruvarkup Pedhaiyaar
Kenmai Oreei Vital
explanation: It is indead a gain for one to renounce the friendship of fools

text:
உள்ளற்க உள்ளம் சிறுகுவ கொள்ளற்க
அல்லற்கண் ஆற்றறுப்பார் நட்பு.
translation: Off with thoughts that depress the heart Off with friends that in woe depart
transliteration:
Ullarka Ullam Sirukuva Kollarka
Allarkan Aatraruppaar Natpu
explanation: Do not think of things that discourage your mind, nor contract friendship with those who would forsake you in adversity

text:
கெடுங்காலைக் கைவிடுவார் கேண்மை அடுங்காலை
உள்ளினும் உள்ளஞ் சுடும்.
translation: Friends who betray at ruin's brink Burn our mind ev'n at death to think
transliteration:
Ketungaalaik Kaivituvaar Kenmai Atungaalai
Ullinum Ullanj Chutum
explanation: The very thought of the friendship of those who have deserted one at the approach of adversity will burn one's mind at the time of death

text:
மருவுக மாசற்றார் கேண்மைஒன் றீத்தும்
ஒருவுக ஒப்பிலார் நட்பு.
translation: The blameless ones as friends embarace; Give something and give up the base
transliteration:
Maruvuka Maasatraar Kenmaion Reeththum
Oruvuka Oppilaar Natpu
explanation: Continue to enjoy the friendship of the pure; (but) renounce even with a gift, the friendship of those who do not agree (with the world)

text:
பழைமை எனப்படுவது யாதெனின் யாதும்
கிழமையைக் கீழ்ந்திடா நட்பு.
translation: That friendship is good amity Which restrains not one's liberty
transliteration:
Pazhaimai Enappatuvadhu Yaadhenin Yaadhum
Kizhamaiyaik Keezhndhitaa Natpu
explanation: Imtimate friendship is that which cannot in the least be injured by (things done through the) right (of longstanding intimacy)

text:
நட்பிற் குறுப்புக் கெழுதகைமை மற்றதற்கு
உப்பாதல் சான்றோர் கடன்.
translation: Friendship's heart is freedom close; Wise men's duty is such to please
transliteration:
Natpir Kuruppuk Kezhudhakaimai Matradharku
Uppaadhal Saandror Katan
explanation: The constituents of friendship are (things done through) the right of intimacy; to be pleased with such a right is the duty of the wise

text:
பழகிய நட்பெவன் செய்யுங் கெழுதகைமை
செய்தாங்கு அமையாக் கடை.
translation: Of long friendship what is the use Righteous freedom if men refuse?
transliteration:
Pazhakiya Natpevan Seyyung Kezhudhakaimai
Seydhaangu Amaiyaak Katai
explanation: Of what avail is long-standing friendship, if friends do not admit as their own actions done through the right of intimacy ?

text:
விழைதகையான் வேண்டி இருப்பர் கெழுதகையாற்
கேளாது நட்டார் செயின்.
translation: Things done unasked by loving friends Please the wise as familiar trends!
transliteration:
Vizhaidhakaiyaan Venti Iruppar Kezhudhakaiyaar
Kelaadhu Nattaar Seyin
explanation: If friends, through the right of friendship, do (anything) without being asked, the wise will be pleased with them on account of its desirability

text:
பேதைமை ஒன்றோ பெருங்கிழமை என்றுணர்க
நோதக்க நட்டார் செயின்.
translation: Offence of friends feel it easy As folloy or close intimacy
transliteration:
Pedhaimai Ondro Perungizhamai Endrunarka
Nodhakka Nattaar Seyin
explanation: If friends should perform what is painful, understand that it is owing not only to ignorance, but also to the strong claims of intimacy

text:
எல்லைக்கண் நின்றார் துறவார் தொலைவிடத்தும்
தொல்லைக்கண் நின்றார் தொடர்பு.
translation: They forsake not but continue In friendship's bounds though loss ensue
transliteration:
Ellaikkan Nindraar Thuravaar Tholaivitaththum
Thollaikkan Nindraar Thotarpu
explanation: Those who stand within the limits (of true friendship) will not even in adversity give up the intimacy of long-standing friends

text:
அழிவந்த செய்யினும் அன்பறார் அன்பின்
வழிவந்த கேண்மை யவர்.
translation: Comrades established in firm love Though ruin comes waive not their vow
transliteration:
Azhivandha Seyyinum Anparaar Anpin
Vazhivandha Kenmai Yavar
explanation: Those who have (long) stood in the path of affection will not give it up even if their friends cause (them) their ruin

text:
கேளிழுக்கம் கேளாக் கெழுதகைமை வல்லார்க்கு
நாளிழுக்கம் நட்டார் செயின்.
translation: Fast friends who list not tales of ill Though wronged they say \"that day is well\"
transliteration:
Kelizhukkam Kelaak Kezhudhakaimai Vallaarkku
Naalizhukkam Nattaar Seyin
explanation: To those who understand that by which they should not listen to (tales about) the faults of their friends, that is a (profitable) day on which the latter may commit a fault

text:
கெடாஅ வழிவந்த கேண்மையார் கேண்மை
விடாஅர் விழையும் உலகு.
translation: To love such friends the world desires Whose friendship has unbroken ties
transliteration:
Ketaaa Vazhivandha Kenmaiyaar Kenmai
Vitaaar Vizhaiyum Ulaku
explanation: They will be loved by the world, who have not forsaken the friendship of those with whom they have kept up an unbroken long-standing intimacy

text:
விழையார் விழையப் படுப பழையார்கண்
பண்பின் தலைப்பிரியா தார்.
translation: Even foes love for better ends Those who leave not long-standing friends
transliteration:
Vizhaiyaar Vizhaiyap Patupa Pazhaiyaarkan
Panpin Thalaippiriyaa Thaar
explanation: Even enemies will love those who have never changed in their affection to their long-standingfriends

text:
பருகுவார் போலினும் பண்பிலார் கேண்மை
பெருகலிற் குன்றல் இனிது.
translation: Swallowing love of soulless men Had better wane than wax anon
transliteration:
Parukuvaar Polinum Panpilaar Kenmai
Perukalir Kundral Inidhu
explanation: The decrease of friendship with those who look as if they would eat you up (through excess of love) while they are really destitute of goodness is far better than its increase

text:
உறின்நட்டு அறின்ஙருஉம் ஒப்பிலார் கேண்மை
பெறினும் இழப்பினும் என்?
translation: Who fawn in wealth and fail in dearth Gain or lose; such friends have no worth
transliteration:
Urinnattu Arinoruum Oppilaar Kenmai
Perinum Izhappinum En?
explanation: Of what avail is it to get or lose the friendship of those who love when there is gain and leave when there is none ?

text:
உறுவது சீர்தூக்கும் நட்பும் பெறுவது
கொள்வாரும் கள்வரும் நேர்.
translation: Cunning friends who calculate  Are like thieves and whores wicked
transliteration:
Uruvadhu Seerdhookkum Natpum Peruvadhu
Kolvaarum Kalvarum Ner
explanation: Friendship who calculate the profits (of their friendship), prostitutes who are bent on obtaining their gains, and thieves are (all) of the same character

text:
அமரகத்து ஆற்றறுக்கும் கல்லாமா அன்னார்
தமரின் தனிமை தலை.
translation: Better be alone than trust in those That throw in field like faithless horse
transliteration:
Amarakaththu Aatrarukkum Kallaamaa Annaar
Thamarin Thanimai Thalai
explanation: Solitude is more to be desired than the society of those who resemble the untrained horses which throw down (their riders) in the fields of battle

text:
செய்தேமஞ் சாராச் சிறியவர் புன்கேண்மை
எய்தலின் எய்தாமை நன்று.
translation: Friends low and mean that give no help- Leave them is better than to keep
transliteration:
Seydhemanj Chaaraach Chiriyavar Punkenmai
Eydhalin Eydhaamai Nandru
explanation: It is far better to avoid that to contract the evil friendship of the base who cannot protect (their friends) even when appointed to do so

text:
பேதை பெருங்கெழீஇ நட்பின் அறிவுடையார்
ஏதின்மை கோடி உறும்.
translation: Million times the wise man's hate Is better than a fool intimate
transliteration:
Pedhai Perungezheei Natpin Arivutaiyaar
Edhinmai Koti Urum
explanation: The hatred of the wise is ten-million times more profitable than the excessive intimacy of the fool

text:
நகைவகைய ராகிய நட்பின் பகைவரால்
பத்தடுத்த கோடி உறும்.
translation: Ten-fold crore you gain from foes Than from friends who are vain laughers
transliteration:
Nakaivakaiya Raakiya Natpin Pakaivaraal
Paththatuththa Koti Urum
explanation: What comes from enemies is a hundred million times more profitable than what comes from the friendship of those who cause only laughter

text:
ஒல்லும் கருமம் உடற்று பவர்கேண்மை
சொல்லாடார் சோர விடல்.
translation: Without a word those friends eschew Who spoil deeds which they can do
transliteration:
Ollum Karumam Utatru Pavarkenmai
Sollaataar Sora Vital
explanation: Gradually abandon without revealing (beforehand) the friendship of those who pretend inability to carry out what they (really) could do

text:
கனவினும் இன்னாது மன்னோ வினைவேறு
சொல்வேறு பட்டார் தொடர்பு.
translation: Even in dreams the tie is bad With those whose deed is far from word
transliteration:
Kanavinum Innaadhu Manno Vinaiveru
Solveru Pattaar Thotarpu
explanation: The friendship of those whose actions do not agree with their words will distress (one) even in (one's) dreams

text:
எனைத்தும் குறுகுதல் ஓம்பல் மனைக்கெழீஇ
மன்றில் பழிப்பார் தொடர்பு.
translation: Keep aloof from those that smile At home and in public revile
transliteration:
Enaiththum Kurukudhal Ompal Manaikkezheei
Mandril Pazhippaar Thotarpu
explanation: Avoid even the least approach to a contraction of friendship with those who would love you in private but ridicule you in public

text:
சீரிடம் காணின் எறிதற்குப் பட் டடை
நேரா நிரந்தவர் நட்பு.
translation: The friendship by an enemy shown Is anvil in time, to strike you down
transliteration:
Seeritam Kaanin Eridharkup Pattatai
Neraa Nirandhavar Natpu
explanation: The friendship of those who behave like friends without inward affection is a weapon that may be thrown when a favourable opportunity presents itself

text:
இனம்போன்று இனமல்லார் கேண்மை மகளிர்
மனம்போல வேறு படும்.
translation: Who pretend kinship but are not Their friendship's fickle like woman's heart
transliteration:
Inampondru Inamallaar Kenmai Makalir
Manampola Veru Patum
explanation: The friendship of those who seem to be friends while they are not, will change like the love of women

text:
பலநல்ல கற்றக் கடைத்து மனநல்லர்
ஆகுதல் மாணார்க் கரிது.
translation: They may be vast in good studies But heartfelt-love is hard for foes
transliteration:
Palanalla Katrak Kataiththu Mananallar
Aakudhal Maanaark Karidhu
explanation: Though (one's) enemies may have mastered many good books, it will be impossible for them to become truly loving at heart

text:
முகத்தின் இனிய நகாஅ அகத்தின்னா
வஞ்சரை அஞ்சப் படும்.
translation: Fear foes whose face has winning smiles Whose heart is full of cunning guiles
transliteration:
Mukaththin Iniya Nakaaa Akaththinnaa
Vanjarai Anjap Patum
explanation: One should fear the deceitful who smile sweetly with their face but never love with their heart

text:
மனத்தின் அமையா தவரை எனைத்தொன்றும்
சொல்லினால் தேறற்பாற்று அன்று.
translation: Do not trust in what they tell Whose mind with your mind goes ill
transliteration:
Manaththin Amaiyaa Thavarai Enaiththondrum
Sollinaal Therarpaatru Andru
explanation: In nothing whatever is it proper to rely on the words of those who do not love with their heart

text:
நட்டார்போல் நல்லவை சொல்லினும் ஒட்டார்சொல்
ஒல்லை உணரப் படும்.
translation: The words of foes is quickly seen Though they speak like friends in fine
transliteration:
Nattaarpol Nallavai Sollinum Ottaarsol
Ollai Unarap Patum
explanation: Though (one's) foes may utter good things as though they were friends, once will at once understand (their evil, import)

text:
சொல்வணக்கம் ஒன்னார்கண் கொள்ளற்க வில்வணக்கம்
தீங்கு குறித்தமை யான்.
translation: Trust not the humble words of foes Danger darts from bending bows
transliteration:
Solvanakkam Onnaarkan Kollarka Vilvanakkam
Theengu Kuriththamai Yaan
explanation: Since the bending of the bow bespeaks evil, one should not accept (as good) the humiliating speeches of one's foes

text:
தொழுதகை யுள்ளும் படையொடுங்கும் ஒன்னார்
அழுதகண் ணீரும் அனைத்து.
translation: Adoring hands of foes hide arms Their sobbing tears have lurking harms
transliteration:
Thozhudhakai Yullum Pataiyotungum Onnaar
Azhudhakan Neerum Anaiththu
explanation: A weapon may be hid in the very hands with which (one's) foes adore (him) (and) the tears they shed are of the same nature

text:
மிகச்செய்து தம்மெள்ளு வாரை நகச்செய்து
நட்பினுள் சாப்புல்லற் பாற்று.
translation: In open who praise, at heart despise Cajole and crush them in friendly guise
transliteration:
Mikachcheydhu Thammellu Vaarai Nakachcheydhu
Natpinul Saappullar Paatru
explanation: It is the duty of kings to affect great love but make it die (inwardly); as regard those foes who shew them great friendship but despise them (in their heart)

text:
பகைநட்பாம் காலம் வருங்கால் முகநட்டு
அகநட்பு ஒரீஇ விடல்.
translation: When foes, in time, play friendship's part Feign love on face but not in heart
transliteration:
Pakainatpaam Kaalam Varungaal Mukanattu
Akanatpu Oreei Vital
explanation: When one's foes begin to affect friendship, one should love them with one's looks, and, cherishing no love in the heart, give up (even the former)

text:
பேதைமை என்பதொன்று யாதெனின் ஏதங்கொண்டு
ஊதியம் போக விடல்.
translation: This is folly's prominent vein To favour loss and forego gain
transliteration:
Pedhaimai Enpadhondru Yaadhenin Edhangontu
Oodhiyam Poka Vital
explanation: Folly is one (of the chief defects); it is that which (makes one) incur loss and forego gain

text:
பேதைமையுள் எல்லாம் பேதைமை காதன்மை
கையல்ல தன்கட் செயல்.
translation: Folly of follies is to lead A lewd and lawless life so bad
transliteration:
Pedhaimaiyul Ellaam Pedhaimai Kaadhanmai
Kaiyalla Thankat Seyal
explanation: The greatest folly is that which leads one to take delight in doing what is forbidden

text:
நாணாமை நாடாமை நாரின்மை யாதொன்றும்
பேணாமை பேதை தொழில்
translation: Shameless, aimless, callous, listless Such are the marks of foolishness
transliteration:
Naanaamai Naataamai Naarinmai Yaadhondrum
Penaamai Pedhai Thozhil
explanation: Shamelessness indifference (to what must be sought after), harshness, and aversion for everything (that ought to be desired) are the qualities of the fool

text:
ஓதி உணர்ந்தும் பிறர் க்குரைத்தும் தானடங்காப்
பேதையின் பேதையார் இல்.
translation: No fool equals the fool who learns Knows, teaches, but self-control spurns
transliteration:
Odhi Unarndhum Pirarkkuraiththum Thaanatangaap
Pedhaiyin Pedhaiyaar Il
explanation: There are no greater fools than he who, though he has read and understood (a great deal) and even taught it to others, does not walk according to his own teaching

text:
ஒருமைச் செயலாற்றும் பேதை எழுமையும்
தான்புக் கழுந்தும் அளறு.
translation: The fool suffers seven fold hells In single birth of hellish ills
transliteration:
Orumaich Cheyalaatrum Pedhai Ezhumaiyum
Thaanpuk Kazhundhum Alaru
explanation: A fool can procure in a single birth a hell into which he may enter and suffer through all the seven births

text:
பொய்படும் ஒன்றோ புனைபூணும் கையறியாப்
பேதை வினைமேற் கொளின்.
translation: A know-nothing fool daring a deed Not only fails but feels fettered
transliteration:
Poipatum Ondro Punaipoonum Kaiyariyaap
Pedhai Vinaimer Kolin
explanation: If the fool, who knows not how to act undertakes a work, he will (certainly) fail (But) is it all ? He will even adorn himself with fetters

text:
ஏதிலார் ஆரத் தமர்பசிப்பர் பேதை
பெருஞ்செல்வம் உற்றக் கடை.
translation: Strangers feast and kinsmen fast  When fools mishandle fortunes vast
transliteration:
Edhilaar Aarath Thamarpasippar Pedhai
Perunjelvam Utrak Katai
explanation: If a fool happens to get an immense fortune, his neighbours will enjoy it while his relations starve

text:
மையல் ஒருவன் களித்தற்றால் பேதைதன்
கையொன்று உடைமை பெறின்.
translation: Fools possessing something on hand Like dazed and drunken stupids stand
transliteration:
Maiyal Oruvan Kaliththatraal Pedhaidhan
Kaiyondru Utaimai Perin
explanation: A fool happening to possess something is like the intoxication of one who is (already) giddy

text:
பெரிதினிது பேதையார் கேண்மை பிரிவின்கண்
பீழை தருவதொன் றில்.
translation: Friendship with fools is highly sweet For without a groan we part
transliteration:
Peridhinidhu Pedhaiyaar Kenmai Pirivinkan
Peezhai Tharuvadhon Ril
explanation: The friendship between fools is exceedingly delightful (to each other): for at parting there will be

text:
கழாஅக்கால் பள்ளியுள் வைத்தற்றால் சான்றோர்
குழாஅத்துப் பேதை புகல்.
translation: Entrance of fools where Savants meet Looks like couch trod by unclean feet
transliteration:
Kazhaaakkaal Palliyul Vaiththatraal Saandror
Kuzhaaaththup Pedhai Pukal
explanation: The appearance of a fool in an assembly of the learned is like placing (one's) unwashed feet on a bed

text:
அறிவின்மை இன்மையுள் இன்மை பிறிதின்மை
இன்மையா வையா துலகு.
translation: Want of wisdom is want of wants Want of aught else the world nev'r counts
transliteration:
Arivinmai Inmaiyul Inmai Piridhinmai
Inmaiyaa Vaiyaa Thulaku
explanation: The want of wisdom is the greatest of all wants; but that of wealth the world will not regard as such

text:
அறிவிலான் நெஞ்சுவந்து ஈதல் பிறிதியாதும்
இல்லை பெறுவான் தவம்.
translation: When fool bestows with glee a gift It comes but by getter's merit
transliteration:
Arivilaan Nenjuvandhu Eedhal Piridhiyaadhum
Illai Peruvaan Thavam
explanation: (The cause of) a fool cheerfully giving (something) is nothing else but the receiver's merit (in a former birth)

text:
அறிவிலார் தாந்தம்மைப் பீழிக்கும் பீழை
செறுவார்க்கும் செய்தல் அரிது.
translation: The self-torments of fools exceed Ev'n tortures of their foes indeed
transliteration:
Arivilaar Thaandhammaip Peezhikkum Peezhai
Seruvaarkkum Seydhal Aridhu
explanation: The suffering that fools inflict upon themselves is hardly possible even to foes

text:
வெண்மை எனப்படுவ தியாதெனின் ஒண்மை
உடையம்யாம் என்னும் செருக்கு.
translation: Stupidity is vanity That cries \"We have sagacity\"
transliteration:
Venmai Enappatuva Thiyaadhenin Onmai
Utaiyamyaam Ennum Serukku
explanation: What is called want of wisdom is the vanity which says, "We are wise"

text:
கல்லாத மேற்கொண் டொழுகல் கசடற
வல்லதூஉம் ஐயம் தரும்.
translation: Feigning knowledge that one has not Leads to doubt ev'n that he has got
transliteration:
Kallaadha Merkon Tozhukal Kasatara
Valladhooum Aiyam Tharum
explanation: Fools pretending to know what has not been read (by them) will rouse suspicion even as to what they have thoroughly mastered

text:
அற்றம் மறைத்தலோ புல்லறிவு தம்வயின்
குற்றம் மறையா வழி.
translation: Fools their nakedness conceal And yet their glaring faults reveal
transliteration:
Atram Maraiththalo Pullarivu Thamvayin
Kutram Maraiyaa Vazhi
explanation: Even to cover one's nakedness would be folly, if (one's) faults were not covered (by forsaking them)

text:
அருமறை சோரும் அறிவிலான் செய்யும்
பெருமிறை தானே தனக்கு.
translation: The fool that slights sacred counsels Upon himself great harm entails
transliteration:
Arumarai Sorum Arivilaan Seyyum
Perumirai Thaane Thanakku
explanation: The fool who neglects precious counsel does, of his own accord, a great injury to himself

text:
ஏவவும் செய்கலான் தான்தேறான் அவ்வுயிர்
போஒம் அளவுமோர் நோய்.
translation: He listens not nor himself knows Plague is his life until it goes
transliteration:
Evavum Seykalaan Thaandheraan Avvuyir
Poom Alavumor Noi
explanation: The fool will not perform (his duties) even when advised nor ascertain them himself; such a soul is a

text:
காணாதான் காட்டுவான் தான்காணான் காணாதான்
கண்டானாம் தான்கண்ட வாறு.
translation: Sans Self-sight in vain one opens Sight To the blind who bet their sight as right
transliteration:
Kaanaadhaan Kaattuvaan Thaankaanaan Kaanaadhaan
Kantaanaam Thaankanta Vaaru
explanation: One who would teach a fool will (simply) betray his folly; and the fool would (still) think himself "wise in his own conceit"

text:
உலகத்தார் உண்டென்பது இல்லென்பான் வையத்து
அலகையா வைக்கப் படும்.
translation: To people's \"Yes\" who proffer \"No\" Deemed as ghouls on earth they go
transliteration:
Ulakaththaar Untenpadhu Illenpaan Vaiyaththu
Alakaiyaa Vaikkap Patum
explanation: He who denies the existence of what the world believes in will be regarded as a demon on earth

text:
இகலென்ப எல்லா உயிர்க்கும் பகலென்னும்
பண்பின்மை பார஧க்கும் நோய்.
translation: Hatred is a plague that divides And rouses illwill on all sides
transliteration:
Ikalenpa Ellaa Uyirkkum Pakalennum
Panpinmai Paarikkum Noi
explanation: The disease which fosters the evil of disunion among all creatures is termed hatred by the wise

text:
பகல்கருதிப் பற்றா செயினும் இகல்கருதி
இன்னாசெய் யாமை தலை.
translation: Rouse not hatred and confusion Though foes provoke disunion
transliteration:
Pakalkarudhip Patraa Seyinum Ikalkarudhi
Innaasey Yaamai Thalai
explanation: Though disagreeable things may be done from (a feeling of) disunion, it is far better that nothing painful be done from (that of) hatred

text:
இகலென்னும் எவ்வநோய் நீக்கின் தவலில்லாத்
தாவில் விளக்கம் தரும்.
translation: Shun the plague of enmity And win everlasting glory
transliteration:
Ikalennum Evvanoi Neekkin Thavalillaath
Thaavil Vilakkam Tharum
explanation: To rid one-self of the distressing dtsease of hatred will bestow (on one) a never-decreasing imperishable fame

text:
இன்பத்துள் இன்பம் பயக்கும் இகலென்னும்
துன்பத்துள் துன்பங் கெடின்.
translation: Hate-the woe of woes destroy; Then joy of joys you can enjoy
transliteration:
Inpaththul Inpam Payakkum Ikalennum
Thunpaththul Thunpang Ketin
explanation: If hatred which is the greatest misery is destroyed, it will yield the greatest delight

text:
இகலெதிர் சாய்ந்தொழுக வல்லாரை யாரே
மிக்லூக்கும் தன்மை யவர்.
translation: Who can overcome them in glory That are free from enmity?
transliteration:
Ikaledhir Saaindhozhuka Vallaarai Yaare
Mikalookkum Thanmai Yavar
explanation: Who indeed would think of conquering those who naturally shrink back from hatred ?

text:
இகலின் மிகலினிது என்பவன் வாழ்க்கை
தவலும் கெடலும் நணித்து.
translation: His fall and ruin are quite near Who holds enmity sweet and dear
transliteration:
Ikalin Mikalinidhu Enpavan Vaazhkkai
Thavalum Ketalum Naniththu
explanation: Failure and ruin are not far from him who says it is sweet to excel in hatred

text:
மிகல்மேவல் மெய்ப்பொருள் காணார் இகல்மேவல்
இன்னா அறிவி னவர்.
translation: They cannot see the supreme Truth Who hate and injure without ruth
transliteration:
Mikalmeval Meypporul Kaanaar Ikalmeval
Innaa Arivi Navar
explanation: Who only know to work men woe, fulfilled of enmity

text:
இகலிற்கு எதிர்சாய்தல் ஆக்கம் அதனை
மிக்லூக்கின் ஊக்குமாம் கேடு.
translation: To turn from enmity is gain Fomenting it brings fast ruin
transliteration:
Ikalirku Edhirsaaidhal Aakkam Adhanai
Mikalookkin Ookkumaam Ketu
explanation: Shrinking back from hatred will yield wealth; indulging in its increase will hasten ruin

text:
இகல்காணான் ஆக்கம் வருங்கால் அதனை
மிகல்காணும் கேடு தரற்கு.
translation: Fortune favours when hate recedes Hatred exceeding ruin breeds
transliteration:
Ikalkaanaan Aakkam Varungaal Adhanai
Mikalkaanum Ketu Thararku
explanation: At the approach of wealth one will not think of hatred (but) to secure one's ruin, one will look to its increase

text:
இகலானாம் இன்னாத எல்லாம் நகலானாம்
நன்னயம் என்னும் செருக்கு.
translation: All evils come from enmity All goodness flow from amity
transliteration:
Ikalaanaam Innaadha Ellaam Nakalaanaam
Nannayam Ennum Serukku
explanation: All calamities are caused by hatred; but by the delight (of friendship) is caused the great wealth of good virtues

text:
வலியார்க்கு மாறேற்றல் ஓம்புக ஓம்பா
மெலியார்மேல் மேக பகை.
translation: Turn from strife with foes too strong With the feeble for battle long
transliteration:
Valiyaarkku Maaretral Ompuka Ompaa
Meliyaarmel Meka Pakai
explanation: Avoid offering resistance to the strong; (but) never fail to cherish enmity towards the weak

text:
அன்பிலன் ஆன்ற துணையிலன் தான்துவ்வான்
என்பரியும் ஏதிலான் துப்பு.
translation: Loveless, aidless, powerless king Can he withstand an enemy strong?
transliteration:
Anpilan Aandra Thunaiyilan Thaandhuvvaan
Enpariyum Edhilaan Thuppu
explanation: How can he who is unloving, destitute of powerful aids, and himself without strength overcome the might of his foe ?

text:
அஞ்சும் அறியான் அமைவிலன் ஈகலான்
தஞ்சம் எளியன் பகைக்கு.
translation: Unskilled, timid, miser, misfit He is easy for foes to hit
transliteration:
Anjum Ariyaan Amaivilan Eekalaan
Thanjam Eliyan Pakaikku
explanation: In the estimation of foes miserably weak is he, who is timid, ignorant, unsociable and niggardly

text:
நீங்கான் வெகுளி நிறையிலன் எஞ்ஞான்றும்
யாங்கணும் யார்க்கும் எளிது.
translation: The wrathful restive man is prey To any, anywhere any day
transliteration:
Neengaan Vekuli Niraiyilan Egngnaandrum
Yaanganum Yaarkkum Elidhu
explanation: He who neither refrains from anger nor keeps his secrets will at all times and in all places be easily conquered by all

text:
வழிநோக்கான் வாய்ப்பன செய்யான் பழிநோக்கான்
பண்பிலன் பற்றார்க்கு இனிது.
translation: Crooked, cruel, tactless and base Any foe can fell him with ease
transliteration:
Vazhinokkaan Vaaippana Seyyaan Pazhinokkaan
Panpilan Patraarkku Inidhu
explanation: (A) pleasing (object) to his foes is he who reads not moral works, does nothing that is enjoined by them cares not for reproach and is not possessed of good qualities

text:
காணாச் சினத்தான் கழிபெருங் காமத்தான்
பேணாமை பேணப் படும்.
translation: Blind in rage and mad in lust To have his hatred is but just
transliteration:
Kaanaach Chinaththaan Kazhiperung Kaamaththaan
Penaamai Penap Patum
explanation: Highly to be desired is the hatred of him whose anger is blind, and whose lust increases beyond measure

text:
கொடுத்தும் கொளல்வேண்டும் மன்ற அடுத்திருந்து
மாணாத செய்வான் பகை.
translation: Pay and buy his enmity Who muddles chance with oddity
transliteration:
Kotuththum Kolalventum Mandra Atuththirundhu
Maanaadha Seyvaan Pakai
explanation: It is indeed necessary to obtain even by purchase the hatred of him who having begun (a work) does what is not conductive (to its accomplishment)

text:
குணனிலனாய்க் குற்றம் பலவாயின் மாற்றார்க்கு
இனனிலனாம் ஏமாப் புடைத்து.
translation: With no virtue but full of vice He loses friends and delights foes
transliteration:
Kunanilanaaik Kutram Palavaayin Maatraarkku
Inanilanaam Emaap Putaiththu
explanation: He will become friendless who is without (any good) qualities and whose faults are many; (such a character) is a help to (his) foes

text:
செறுவார்க்குச் சேணிகவா இன்பம் அறிவிலா
அஞ்சும் பகைவர்ப் பெறின்.
translation: The joy of heroes knows no bounds When timid fools are opponents
transliteration:
Seruvaarkkuch Chenikavaa Inpam Arivilaa
Anjum Pakaivarp Perin
explanation: There will be no end of lofty delights to the victorious, if their foes are (both) ignorant and timid

text:
கல்லான் வெகுளும் சிறுபொருள் எஞ்ஞான்றும்
ஒல்லானை ஒல்லா தொளி.
translation: Glory's light he will not gain Who fails to fight a fool and win
transliteration:
Kallaan Vekulum Siruporul Egngnaandrum
Ollaanai Ollaa Tholi
explanation: The light (of fame) will never be gained by him who gains not the trifling reputation of having fought an unlearned (foe)

text:
பகைஎன்னும் பண்பி லதனை ஒருவன்
நகையேயும் வேண்டற்பாற்று அன்று.
translation: Let not one even as a sport The ill-natured enmity court
transliteration:
Pakaiennum Panpi Ladhanai Oruvan
Nakaiyeyum Ventarpaatru Andru
explanation: The evil of hatred is not of a nature to be desired by one even in sport

text:
வில்லேர் உழவர் பகைகொளினும் கொள்ளற்க
சொல்லேர் உழவர் பகை.
translation: Incur the hate of bow-ploughers But not the hate of word-ploughers
transliteration:
Viller Uzhavar Pakaikolinum Kollarka
Soller Uzhavar Pakai
explanation: Though you may incur the hatred of warriors whose ploughs are bows, incur not that of ministers whose ploughs are words

text:
ஏமுற் றவரினும் ஏழை தமியனாய்ப்
பல்லார் பகைகொள் பவன்.
translation: Forlorn, who rouses many foes The worst insanity betrays
transliteration:
Emur Ravarinum Ezhai Thamiyanaaip
Pallaar Pakaikol Pavan
explanation: He who being alone, incurs the hatred of many is more infatuated than even mad men

text:
பகைநட்பாக் கொண்டொழுகும் பண்புடை யாளன்
தகைமைக்கண் தங்கிற்று உலகு.
translation: This world goes safely in his grace Whose heart makes friends even of foes
transliteration:
Pakainatpaak Kontozhukum Panputai Yaalan
Thakaimaikkan Thangitru Ulaku
explanation: Whose worthy rule can change his foes to friends

text:
தன்துணை இன்றால் பகையிரண்டால் தான்ஒருவன்
இன்துணையாக் கொள்கவற்றின் ஒன்று.
translation: Alone, if two foes you oppose Make one of them your ally close
transliteration:
Thandhunai Indraal Pakaiyirantaal Thaanoruvan
Indhunaiyaak Kolkavatrin Ondru
explanation: He who is alone and helpless while his foes are two should secure one of them as an agreeable help (to himself)

text:
தேற஧னும் தேறா விடினும் அழிவின்கண்
தேறான் பகாஅன் விடல்.
translation: Trust or distrust; during distress Keep aloof; don't mix with foes
transliteration:
Thera�num Theraa Vitinum Azhivinkan
Theraan Pakaaan Vital
explanation: Though (one's foe is) aware or not of one's misfortune one should act so as neither to join nor separate (from him)

text:
நோவற்க நொந்தது அறியார்க்கு மேவற்க
மென்மை பகைவர் அகத்து.
translation: To those who know not, tell not your pain Nor your weakness to foes explain
transliteration:
Novarka Nondhadhu Ariyaarkku Mevarka
Menmai Pakaivar Akaththu
explanation: Relate not your suffering even to friends who are ignorant of it, nor refer to your weakness in the presence of your foes

text:
வகையறிந்து தற்செய்து தற்காப்ப மாயும்
பகைவர்கண் பட்ட செருக்கு.
translation: Know how and act and defend well The pride of enemies shall fall
transliteration:
Vakaiyarindhu Tharseydhu Tharkaappa Maayum
Pakaivarkan Patta Serukku
